ience.%20Additionally,%20our%20design%20principles%20have%20a%20strong%20focus%20on%20accessibility%20best%20practices.%20%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20are%20excited%20to%20share%20Denali%20with%20the%20open%20source%20community.%20We%20look%20forward%20to%20seeing%20what%20you%20build%20with%20Denali%20as%20well%20as%20your%20contributions%20and%20feedback!%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EStay%20tuned%20for%20exciting%20updates%20and%20reach%20out%20to%20us%20on%20twitter%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://twitter.com/@denali_design%22%3E@denali_design%3C/a%3E%20or%20via%20%3Ca%20href=%22mailto:denali@verizonmedia.com%22%3Eemail%3C/a%3E.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EAcknowledgments%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/romeot/%22%3EJay%20Torres%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/chasturansky/%22%3EChas%20Turansky%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/marcosandovaldesign/%22%3EMarco%20Sandoval%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/chrisesler/%22%3EChris%20Esler%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/denchen/%22%3EDennis%20Chen%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/jon-kilroy-52545b4/%22%3EJon%20Kilroy%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/gilyehuda/%22%3EGil%20Yehuda%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/ashleywolf/%22%3EAshley%20Wolf%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/rosaliebartlett/%22%3ERosalie%20Bartlett%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E,https://yahoodevelopers.tumblr.com/post/186682632468
mailto:?subject=Introducing%20HaloDB,%20a%20fast,%20embedded%20key-value%20storage%20engine%20written%20in%20Java&body=%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://yahoodevelopers.tumblr.com/post/178250134648/introducing-halodb-a-fast-embedded-key-value%22%20class=%22tumblr_blog%22%3Eyahoodevelopers%3C/a%3E:%3C/p%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3Cp%3EBy%20Arjun%20Mannaly,%20Senior%20Software%20Engineer%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAt%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.oath.com/our-brands/%22%3EOath%3C/a%3E,%20multiple%20ad%20platforms%20use%20a%20high%20throughput,%20low%20latency%20distributed%20key-value%20database%20that%20runs%20in%20data%20centers%20all%20over%20the%20world.%20The%20database%20stores%20billions%20of%20records%20and%20handles%20millions%20of%20read%20and%20write%20requests%20per%20second%20at%20millisecond%20latencies.%20The%20data%20we%20have%20in%20this%20database%20must%20be%20persistent,%20and%20the%20working%20set%20is%20larger%20than%20what%20we%20can%20fit%20in%20memory.%20Therefore,%20a%20key%20component%20of%20the%20database%20performance%20is%20a%20fast%20storage%20engine.%20Our%20current%20solution%20had%20served%20us%20well,%20but%20it%20was%20primarily%20designed%20for%20a%20read-heavy%20workload%20and%20its%20write%20throughput%20started%20to%20be%20a%20bottleneck%20as%20write%20traffic%20increased.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThere%20were%20other%20additional%20concerns%20as%20well;%20it%20took%20hours%20to%20repair%20a%20corrupted%20DB,%20or%20iterate%20over%20and%20delete%20records.%20The%20storage%20engine%20also%20didn%E2%80%99t%20expose%20enough%20operational%20metrics.%20The%20primary%20concern%20though%20was%20the%20write%20performance,%20which%20based%20on%20our%20projections,%20would%20have%20been%20a%20major%20obstacle%20for%20scaling%20the%20database.%20With%20these%20concerns%20in%20mind,%20we%20began%20searching%20for%20an%20alternative%20solution.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20searched%20for%20a%20key-value%20storage%20engine%20capable%20of%20dealing%20with%20IO-bound%20workloads,%20with%20submillisecond%20read%20latencies%20under%20high%20read%20and%20write%20throughput.%20After%20concluding%20our%20research%20and%20benchmarking%20alternatives,%20we%20didn%E2%80%99t%20find%20a%20solution%20that%20worked%20for%20our%20workload,%20thus%20we%20were%20inspired%20to%20build%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/HaloDB%22%3EHaloDB%3C/a%3E.%20Now,%20we%E2%80%99re%20glad%20to%20announce%20that%20it%E2%80%99s%20also%20open%20source%20and%20available%20to%20use%20under%20the%20terms%20of%20the%20Apache%20license.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EHaloDB%20has%20given%20our%20production%20boxes%20a%2050%%20improvement%20in%20write%20capacity%20while%20consistently%20maintaining%20a%20submillisecond%20read%20latency%20at%20the%2099th%20percentile.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EArchitecture%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%222368%22%20data-orig-height=%221368%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/04e736daa5dde2107603a9dd3dc0731c/tumblr_inline_pf9yuxWhcu1w911gs_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%222368%22%20data-orig-height=%221368%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/HaloDB%22%3EHaloDB%3C/a%3E%20primarily%20consists%20of%20append-only%20log%20files%20on%20disk%20and%20an%20index%20of%20keys%20in%20memory.%20All%20writes%20are%20sequential%20writes%20which%20go%20to%20an%20append-only%20log%20file%20and%20the%20file%20is%20rolled-over%20once%20it%20reaches%20a%20configurable%20size.%20Older%20versions%20of%20records%20are%20removed%20to%20make%20space%20by%20a%20background%20compaction%20job.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20in-memory%20index%20in%20HaloDB%20is%20a%20hash%20table%20which%20stores%20all%20keys%20and%20their%20associated%20metadata.%20The%20size%20of%20the%20in-memory%20index,%20depending%20on%20the%20number%20of%20keys,%20can%20be%20quite%20large,%20hence%20for%20performance%20reasons,%20is%20stored%20outside%20the%20Java%20heap,%20in%20native%20memory.%20When%20looking%20up%20the%20value%20for%20a%20key,%20corresponding%20metadata%20is%20first%20read%20from%20the%20in-memory%20index%20and%20then%20the%20value%20is%20read%20from%20disk.%20Each%20lookup%20request%20requires%20at%20most%20a%20single%20read%20from%20disk.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EPerformance%20%C2%A0%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20chart%20below%20shows%20the%20results%20of%20performance%20tests%20with%20real%20production%20data.%20The%20read%20requests%20were%20kept%20at%2050,000%20QPS%20while%20the%20write%20QPS%20was%20increased.%20HaloDB%20scaled%20very%20well%20as%20we%20increased%20the%20write%20QPS%20while%20consistently%20maintaining%20submillisecond%20read%20latencies%20at%20the%2099th%20percentile.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221952%22%20data-orig-height=%221070%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/7efd59fbfac8948311bd06b94bb13a3d/tumblr_inline_pf9yw2U2pf1w911gs_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221952%22%20data-orig-height=%221070%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20chart%20below%20shows%20the%2099th%20percentile%20latency%20from%20a%20production%20server%20before%20and%20after%20migration%20to%20HaloDB.%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%222092%22%20data-orig-height=%22852%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/04498b8293449c7b5cec6052fa80d6e4/tumblr_inline_pf9yzvzNGz1w911gs_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%222092%22%20data-orig-height=%22852%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0If%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/HaloDB%22%3EHaloDB%3C/a%3E%20sounds%20like%20a%20helpful%20solution%20to%20you,%20please%20feel%20free%20to%20use%20it,%20open%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/halodb/issues%22%3Eissues%3C/a%3E,%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/HaloDB/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md%22%3Econtribute%3C/a%3E!%3C/p%3E%3C/blockquote%3E,https://yahooeng.tumblr.com/post/178262468576
mailto:?subject=Introducing%20ONNX%20support&body=%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EONNX%20(Open%20Neural%20Network%20eXchange)%20is%20an%20open%20format%20for%20the%20sharing%20of%20neural%20network%20and%20other%20machine%20learned%20models%20between%20various%20machine%20learning%20and%20deep%20learning%20frameworks.%20As%20the%20open%20big%20data%20serving%20engine,%20Vespa%20aims%20to%20make%20it%20simple%20to%20evaluate%20machine%20learned%20models%20at%20serving%20time%20at%20scale.%20By%20adding%20ONNX%20support%20in%20Vespa%20in%20addition%20to%20our%20existing%20TensorFlow%20support,%20we&rsquo;ve%20made%20it%20possible%C2%A0to%20evaluate%20models%20from%20all%20the%20commonly%20used%20ML%20frameworks%20with%20low%20latency%C2%A0over%20large%20amounts%20of%20data.%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWith%20the%20rise%20of%20deep%20learning%20in%20the%20last%20few%20years,%20we&rsquo;ve%20naturally%20enough%20seen%20an%20increase%20of%20deep%20learning%20frameworks%20as%20well:%20TensorFlow,%20PyTorch/Caffe2,%20MxNet%20etc.%20One%20reason%20for%20these%20different%20frameworks%20to%20exist%20is%20that%20they%20have%20been%20developed%20and%20optimized%20around%20some%20characteristic,%20such%20as%20fast%20training%20on%20distributed%20systems%20or%20GPUs,%20or%20efficient%20evaluation%20on%20mobile%20devices.%20Previously,%20complex%20projects%20with%20non-trivial%20data%20pipelines%20have%20been%20unable%20to%20pick%20the%20best%20framework%20for%20any%20given%20subtask%20due%20to%20lacking%20interoperability%20between%20these%20frameworks.%20ONNX%20is%20a%20solution%20to%20this%20problem.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://onnx.ai/%22%3EONNX%3C/a%3E%20is%20an%20open%20format%20for%20AI%20models,%20and%20represents%20an%20effort%20to%20push%20open%20standards%20in%20AI%20forward.%20The%20goal%20is%20to%20help%20increase%20the%20speed%20of%20innovation%20in%20the%20AI%20community%20by%20enabling%20interoperability%20between%20different%20frameworks%20and%20thus%20streamlining%20the%20process%20of%20getting%20models%20from%20research%20to%20production.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThere%20is%20one%20commonality%20between%20the%20frameworks%20mentioned%20above%20that%20enables%20an%20open%20format%20such%20as%20ONNX,%20and%20that%20is%20that%20they%20all%20make%20use%20of%20dataflow%20graphs%20in%20one%20way%20or%20another.%20While%20there%20are%20differences%20between%20each%20framework,%20they%20all%20provide%20APIs%20enabling%20developers%20to%20construct%20computational%20graphs%20and%20runtimes%20to%20process%20these%20graphs.%20Even%20though%20these%20graphs%20are%20conceptually%20similar,%20each%20framework%20has%20been%20a%20siloed%20stack%20of%20API,%20graph%20and%20runtime.%20The%20goal%20of%20ONNX%20is%20to%20empower%20developers%20to%20select%20the%20framework%20that%20works%20best%20for%20their%20project,%20by%20providing%20an%20extensible%20computational%20graph%20model%20that%20works%20as%20a%20common%20intermediate%20representation%20at%20any%20stage%20of%20development%20or%20deployment.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EVespa%20is%20an%20open%20source%20project%20which%20fits%20well%20within%20such%20an%20ecosystem,%20and%20we%20aim%20to%20make%20the%20process%20of%20deploying%20and%20serving%20models%20to%20production%20that%20have%20been%20trained%20on%20any%20framework%20as%20smooth%20as%20possible.%20Vespa%20is%20optimized%20toward%20serving%20and%20evaluating%20over%20potentially%20very%20large%20datasets%20while%20still%20responding%20in%20real%20time.%20In%20contrast%20to%20other%20ML%20model%20serving%20options,%20Vespa%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://blog.vespa.ai/post/173669458506/scaling-tensorflow-model-evaluation-with-vespa%22%3Ecan%20more%20efficiently%20evaluate%20models%20over%20many%20data%20points%3C/a%3E.%20As%20such,%20Vespa%20is%20an%20excellent%20choice%20when%20combining%20model%20evaluation%20with%20serving%20of%20various%20types%20of%20content.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOur%20ONNX%20support%20is%20quite%20similar%20to%20our%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://blog.vespa.ai/post/171861434281/introducing-tensorflow-support%22%3ETensorFlow%20support%3C/a%3E.%20Importing%20ONNX%20models%20is%20as%20simple%20as%20adding%20the%20model%20to%20the%20Vespa%20application%20package%20(under%20&ldquo;models/&rdquo;)%20and%20referencing%20the%20model%20using%20the%20new%20ONNX%20ranking%20feature:%3C/p%3E%3Cpre%3Eexpression:%20sum(onnx(%22my_model.onnx%22))%3C/pre%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20above%20expression%20runs%20the%20model%20and%20sums%20it%20to%20a%20single%20scalar%20value%20to%20use%20in%20ranking.%20You%20will%20have%20to%20provide%20the%20inputs%20to%20the%20graph.%20Vespa%20expects%20you%20to%20provide%20a%20macro%20with%20the%20same%20name%20as%20the%20input%20tensor.%20In%20the%20macro%20you%20can%20specify%20where%20the%20input%20should%20come%20from,%20be%20it%20a%20document%20field,%20constant%20or%20a%20parameter%20sent%20along%20with%20the%20query.%20More%20information%20can%20be%20had%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/onnx.html%22%3Ein%20the%20documentation%20about%20ONNX%20import%3C/a%3E.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EInternally,%20Vespa%20converts%20the%20ONNX%20operations%20to%20Vespa&rsquo;s%20tensor%20API.%20We%20do%20the%20same%20for%20TensorFlow%20import.%20So%20the%20cost%20of%20evaluating%20ONNX%20and%20TensorFlow%20models%20are%20the%20same.%20We%20have%20put%20a%20lot%20of%20effort%20in%20optimizing%20the%20evaluation%20of%20tensors,%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/onnx.html%22%3Eevaluating%20neural%20network%20models%20can%20be%20quite%20efficient%3C/a%3E.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EONNX%20support%20is%20also%20quite%20new%20to%20Vespa,%20so%20we%20do%20not%20support%20all%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Operators.md%22%3Ecurrent%20ONNX%20operations%3C/a%3E.%20Part%20of%20the%20reason%20we%20don&rsquo;t%20support%20all%20operations%20yet%20is%20that%20some%20are%20potentially%20too%20expensive%20to%20evaluate%20per%20document,%20such%20as%20convolutional%20neural%20networks%20and%20recurrent%20networks%20(LSTMs%20etc).%20ONNX%20also%20contains%20an%20extension,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/onnx/onnx/blob/master/docs/Operators-ml.md%22%3EONNX-ML%3C/a%3E,%20which%20contains%20additional%20operations%20for%20non-neural%20network%20cases.%20Support%20for%20this%20extension%20will%20come%20later%20at%20some%20point.%20We%20are%20continually%20working%20to%20add%20functionality,%20so%20please%20reach%20out%20to%20us%20if%20there%20is%20something%20you%20would%20like%20to%20have%20added.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EGoing%20forward%20we%20are%20continually%20working%20on%20improving%20performance%20as%20well%20as%20supporting%20more%20of%20the%20ONNX%20(and%20ONNX-ML)%20standard.%20You%20can%20read%20more%20about%20ranking%20with%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/onnx.html%22%3EONNX%20models%20in%20the%20Vespa%20documentation%3C/a%3E.%20We%20are%20excited%20to%20announce%20ONNX%20support.%20Let%20us%20know%20what%20you%20are%20building%20with%20it!%3C/p%3E,http://blog.vespa.ai/post/175233055656
mailto:?subject=Introducing%20Oak:%20an%20Open%20Source%20Scalable%20Key-Value%20Map%20for%20Big%20Data%20Analytics&body=%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://yahoodevelopers.tumblr.com/post/178045146133/introducing-oak-an-open-source-scalable-key-value%22%20class=%22tumblr_blog%22%3Eyahoodevelopers%3C/a%3E:%3C/p%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3Cp%3EBy%20Dmitry%20Basin,%20Edward%20Bortnikov,%20Anastasia%20Braginsky,%20Eshcar%20Hillel,%20Idit%20Keidar,%20Hagar%20Meir,%20Gali%20Sheffi%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EReal-time%20analytics%20applications%20are%20on%20the%20rise.%20Modern%20decision%20support%20and%20machine%20intelligence%20engines%20strive%20to%20continuously%20ingest%20large%20volumes%20of%20data%20while%20providing%20up-to-date%20insights%20with%20minimum%20delay.%20For%20example,%20in%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://www.flurry.com/%22%3EFlurry%20Analytics%3C/a%3E,%20an%20Oath%20service%20which%20provides%20mobile%20developers%20with%20rich%20tools%20to%20explore%20user%20behavior%20in%20real%20time,%20it%20only%20takes%20seconds%20to%20reflect%20the%20events%20that%20happened%20on%20mobile%20devices%20in%20its%20numerous%20dashboards.%20The%20scalability%20demand%20is%20immense%20%E2%80%93%20as%20of%20late%202017,%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://flurrymobile.tumblr.com/post/169545749110/state-of-mobile-2017-mobile-stagnates%22%3Ethe%20Flurry%20SDK%20was%20installed%20on%202.6B%20devices%20and%20monitored%201M+%20mobile%20apps%3C/a%3E.%20Mobile%20data%20hits%20the%20Flurry%20backend%20at%20a%20huge%20rate,%20updates%20statistics%20across%20hundreds%20of%20dimensions,%20and%20becomes%20queryable%20immediately.%20Flurry%20harnesses%20the%20open-source%20distributed%20interactive%20analytics%20engine%20named%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://druid.io/%22%3EDruid%3C/a%3E%20to%20ingest%20data%20and%20serve%20queries%20at%20this%20massive%20rate.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20order%20to%20minimize%20delays%20before%20data%20becomes%20available%20for%20analysis,%20technologies%20like%20Druid%20should%20avoid%20maintaining%20separate%20systems%20for%20data%20ingestion%20and%20query%20serving,%20and%20instead%20strive%20to%20do%20both%20within%20the%20same%20system.%20Doing%20so%20is%20nontrivial%20since%20one%20cannot%20compromise%20on%20overall%20correctness%20when%20multiple%20conflicting%20operations%20execute%20in%20parallel%20on%20modern%20multi-core%20CPUs.%20A%20promising%20approach%20is%20using%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.amazon.com/Art-Multiprocessor-Programming-Revised-Reprint/dp/0123973376%22%3Econcurrent%20data%20structure%3C/a%3E%20(CDS)%20algorithms%20which%20adapt%20traditional%20data%20structures%20to%20multiprocessor%20hardware.%20CDS%20implementations%20are%20thread-safe%20%E2%80%93%20that%20is,%20developers%20can%20use%20them%20exactly%20as%20sequential%20code%20while%20maintaining%20strong%20theoretical%20correctness%20guarantees.%20In%20recent%20years,%20CDS%20algorithms%20enabled%20dramatic%20application%20performance%20scaling%20and%20became%20popular%20programming%20tools.%20For%20example,%20Java%20programmers%20can%20use%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentNavigableMap.html%22%3EConcurrentNavigableMap%3C/a%3E%20JDK%20implementations%20for%20the%20concurrent%20ordered%20key-value%20map%20abstraction%20that%20is%20instrumental%20in%20systems%20like%20Druid.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EToday,%20we%20are%20excited%20to%20share%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/oak%22%3EOak%3C/a%3E,%20a%20new%20open%20source%20project%20from%20Oath,%20available%20under%20the%20Apache%20License%202.0.%20The%20project%20was%20created%20by%20the%20Scalable%20Systems%20team%20at%20Yahoo%20Research.%20It%20extends%20upon%20our%20earlier%20research%20work,%20named%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=3018761%22%3EKiWi%3C/a%3E.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOak%20is%20a%20Java%20package%20that%20implements%20OakMap%20%E2%80%93%20a%20concurrent%20ordered%20key-value%20map.%20OakMap%E2%80%99s%20API%20is%20similar%20to%20Java%E2%80%99s%20ConcurrentNavigableMap.%20Java%20developers%20will%20find%20it%20easy%20to%20switch%20most%20of%20their%20applications%20to%20it.%20OakMap%20provides%20the%20safety%20guarantees%20specified%20by%20ConcurrentNavigableMap%E2%80%99s%20programming%20model.%20However,%20it%20scales%20with%20the%20RAM%20and%20CPU%20resources%20well%20beyond%20the%20best-in-class%20ConcurrentNavigableMap%20implementations.%20For%20example,%20it%20compares%20favorably%20to%20Doug%20Lea%E2%80%99s%20seminal%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentSkipListMap.html%22%3EConcurrentSkipListMap%3C/a%3E,%20which%20is%20used%20by%20multiple%20big%20data%20platforms,%20including%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://hbase.apache.org/%22%3EApache%20HBase%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://druid.io/%22%3EDruid%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/Netflix/EVCache%22%3EEVCache%3C/a%3E,%20etc.%20Our%20benchmarks%20show%20that%20OakMap%20harnesses%203x%20more%20memory,%20and%20runs%203x-5x%20faster%20on%20analytics%20workloads.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOakMap%E2%80%99s%20implementation%20is%20very%20different%20from%20traditional%20implementations%20such%20as%20%C2%A0ConcurrentSkipListMap.%20While%20the%20latter%20maintains%20all%20keys%20and%20values%20as%20individual%20Java%20objects,%20OakMap%20stores%20them%20in%20very%20large%20memory%20buffers%20allocated%20beyond%20the%20JVM-managed%20memory%20heap%20(hence%20the%20name%20Oak%20-%20abbr.%20Off-heap%20Allocated%20Keys).%20The%20access%20to%20the%20key-value%20pairs%20is%20provided%20by%20a%20lightweight%20two-level%20on-heap%20index.%20At%20its%20lower%20level,%20the%20references%20to%20keys%20are%20stored%20in%20contiguous%20chunks,%20each%20responsible%20for%20a%20distinct%20key%20range.%20The%20chunks%20themselves,%20which%20dominate%20the%20index%20footprint,%20are%20accessed%20through%20a%20lightweight%20top-level%20ConcurrentSkipListMap.%20The%20figure%20below%20illustrates%20OakMap%E2%80%99s%20data%20organization.%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221280%22%20data-orig-height=%22960%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/337ca872afdcf4b86d6a47051472a787/tumblr_inline_pf046lmN2K1w911gs_540.jpg%22%20data-orig-width=%221280%22%20data-orig-height=%22960%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ci%3EOakMap%20structure.%3C/i%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20maintenance%20of%20OakMap%E2%80%99s%20chunked%20index%20in%20a%20concurrent%20setting%20is%20the%20crux%20of%20its%20complexity%20as%20well%20as%20the%20key%20for%20its%20efficiency.%20Experiments%20have%20shown%20that%20our%20algorithm%20is%20advantageous%20in%20multiple%20ways:%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E1.%20%3Cb%3EMemory%20scaling.%20%3C/b%3EOakMap%E2%80%99s%20custom%20off-heap%20memory%20allocation%20alleviates%20the%20garbage%20collection%20(GC)%20overhead%20that%20plagues%20Java%20applications.%20Despite%20the%20permanent%20progress,%20modern%20Java%20GC%20algorithms%20do%20not%20practically%20scale%20beyond%20a%20few%20tens%20of%20GBs%20of%20memory,%20whereas%20OakMap%20scales%20beyond%20128GB%20of%20off-heap%20RAM.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E2.%20%3Cb%3EQuery%20speed.%20%3C/b%3EThe%20chunk-based%20layout%20increases%20data%20locality,%20which%20speeds%20up%20both%20single-key%20lookups%20and%20range%20scans.%20All%20queries%20enjoy%20efficient,%20cache-friendly%20access,%20in%20contrast%20with%20permanent%20dereferencing%20in%20object-based%20maps.%20On%20top%20of%20these%20basic%20merits,%20OakMap%20provides%20safe%20direct%20access%20to%20its%20chunks,%20which%20avoids%20an%20extra%20copy%20for%20rebuilding%20the%20original%20key%20and%20value%20objects.%20Our%20benchmarks%20demonstrate%20OakMap%E2%80%99s%20performance%20benefits%20versus%20ConcurrentSkipListMap:%3C/p%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3Cp%3EA)%20Up%20to%202x%20throughput%20for%20ascending%20scans.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EB)%20Up%20to%205x%20throughput%20for%20descending%20scans.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EC)%20Up%20to%203x%20throughput%20for%20lookups.%3C/p%3E%3C/blockquote%3E%3Cp%3E3.%20%3Cb%3EUpdate%20speed.%20%3C/b%3EBeyond%20avoiding%20the%20GC%20overhead%20typical%20for%20write-intensive%20workloads,%20OakMap%20optimizes%20the%20incremental%20maintenance%20of%20big%20complex%20values%20%E2%80%93%20for%20example,%20aggregate%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://datasketches.github.io/%22%3Edata%20sketches%3C/a%3E,%20which%20are%20indispensable%20in%20systems%20like%20Druid.%20It%20adopts%20in%20situ%20computation%20on%20objects%20embedded%20in%20its%20internal%20chunks%20to%20avoid%20unnecessary%20data%20copy,%20yet%20again.%20In%20our%20benchmarks,%20OakMap%20achieves%20up%20to%201.8x%20data%20ingestion%20rate%20versus%20ConcurrentSkipListMap.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWith%20key-value%20maps%20being%20an%20extremely%20generic%20abstraction,%20it%20is%20easy%20to%20envision%20a%20variety%20of%20use%20cases%20for%20OakMap%20in%20large-scale%20analytics%20and%20machine%20learning%20applications%20%E2%80%93%20such%20as%20unstructured%20key-value%20storage,%20structured%20databases,%20in-memory%20caches,%20parameter%20servers,%20etc.%20For%20example,%20we%20are%20already%20working%20with%20the%20Druid%20community%20on%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/apache/incubator-druid/pull/5732%22%3Erebuilding%20Druid%E2%80%99s%20core%20Incremental%20Index%3C/a%3E%20component%20around%20OakMap,%20in%20order%20to%20boost%20its%20scalability%20and%20performance.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20look%20forward%20to%20growing%20the%20Oak%20community!%20We%20invite%20you%20to%20explore%20the%20project,%20use%20OakMap%20in%20your%20applications,%20raise%20issues,%20suggest%20improvements,%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/Oak/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md%22%3Econtribute%20code%3C/a%3E.%20If%20you%20have%20any%20questions,%20please%20feel%20free%20to%20send%20us%20a%20note%20on%20the%20Oak%20developers%20list:%20%3Ca%20href=%22mailto:oakproject@googlegroups.com%22%3Eoakproject@googlegroups.com%3C/a%3E.%20It%20would%20be%20great%20to%20hear%20from%20you!%3C/p%3E%3C/blockquote%3E,https://yahooeng.tumblr.com/post/178045294111

n.wikipedia.org/wiki/ACID%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3EACID%3C/a%3E%20(Atomicity,%20Consistency,%20Isolation,%20Durability)%20properties,%20just%20as%20they%20would%20use%20transactions%20in%20the%20relational%20database%20world.%20Omid%20extends%20the%20HBase%20key-value%20access%20APl%20with%20transaction%20semantics.%20It%20can%20be%20exercised%20either%20directly,%20or%20via%20higher%20level%20data%20management%20API%E2%80%99s.%20For%20example,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://phoenix.apache.org/%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3EApache%20Phoenix%3C/a%3E%20(SQL-on-top-of-HBase)%20might%20use%20Omid%20as%20its%20transaction%20management%20component.%20%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EACID%20transactions%20are%20a%20hugely%20popular%20programming%20models%20that%20are%20featured%20by%20relational%20databases.%20While%20early%20NoSQL%20data%20store%20implementations%20did%20not%20include%20transaction%20support,%20the%20need%20for%20transactions%20soon%20emerged.%20Today,%20they%20are%20perceived%20as%20essential%20to%20modern%20ultra-scalable,%20dynamic%20content%20processing%20systems.%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20system%20design%20is%20inspired%20in%20part%20by%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://research.google.com/pubs/pub36726.html%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3EPercolator%3C/a%3E,%20Google%E2%80%99s%20dynamic%20web%20indexing%20technology,%20which%20reintroduced%20transactions%20to%20the%20NoSQL%20world%20in%202010.%C2%A0%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20current%20version%20of%20Omid%20provides%20an%20easy-to-program,%20easy-to-operate,%20reliable,%20high-performance%20platform,%20capable%20of%20serving%20transactional%20web-scale%20applications%20based%20on%20HBase.%20The%20following%20features%20make%20it%20an%20attractive%20choice%20for%20system%20designers:%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ci%3EDevelopment%3C/i%3E.%20Omid%20is%20backward-compatible%20with%20HBase%20APIs,%20making%20it%20developer%20friendly.%20Minimal%20extensions%20are%20introduced%20to%20enable%20transactions.%C2%A0%C2%A0%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ci%3ESemantics%3C/i%3E.%20Omid%20implements%20a%20popular,%20well-tracted%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=69541%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3ESnapshot%20Isolation%20%3C/a%3E(SI)%20consistency%20paradigm%20that%20is%20supported%20by%20major%20SQL%20and%20NoSQL%20technologies%20(for%20example,%20Percolator).%20%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ci%3EScalability.%3C/i%3E%20Omid%20%C2%A0provides%20a%20highly%20scalable,%20lock-free%20implementation%20of%20SI.%20To%20the%20best%20of%20our%20knowledge,%20it%20is%20the%20only%20open%20source%20NoSQL%20platform%20that%20can%20scale%20beyond%20100K%20transactions%20per%20second.%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ci%3EReliability%3C/i%3E.%20%C2%A0Omid%20has%20a%20high-availability%20(HA)%20mode,%20in%20which%20the%20core%20service%20operates%20as%20primary-backup%20process%20pair%20with%20automatic%20failover.%20The%20HA%20support%20has%20zero%20overhead%20on%20the%20mainstream%20operation.%C2%A0%C2%A0%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ci%3ESimplicity%3C/i%3E.%20Omid%20leverages%20the%20HBase%20infrastructure%20for%20managing%20its%20own%20metadata.%20It%20entails%20no%20additional%20services%20apart%20from%20those%20used%20by%20HBase.%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ci%3ETrack%20Record%3C/i%3E.%20Omid%20is%20already%20in%20use%20by%20very-large-scale%20production%20systems%20at%20Yahoo.%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp%3ETo%20start%20working%20with%20Omid,%20you%20should%20be%20familiar%20with%20the%20key%20concepts%20of%20transaction%20%C2%A0processing.%20Wherever%20appropriate,%20we%20will%20provide%20the%20theoretical%20background%20required%20to%20explain%20how%20Omid%20works.%20For%20a%20deeper%20understanding,%20we%20recommend%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://www.amazon.com/Transaction-Processing-Concepts-Techniques-Management/dp/1558601902%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3EGray%20and%20Reuter%E2%80%99s%20book%20on%20transaction%20processing%3C/a%3E.%20%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EA%20Web-Scale%20Use%20Case%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAt%20Yahoo,%20Omid%20is%20a%20foundational%20technology%20for%20Sieve,%20a%20content%20management%20platform%20that%20powers%20our%20next-generation%20search%20and%20personalization%20products.%20Sieve%20essentially%20acts%20as%20a%20huge%20processing%20hub%20between%20content%20feeds%20and%20serving%20systems.%20It%20provides%20an%20environment%20for%20highly%20customizable,%20real-time,%20streamed%20information%20processing,%20with%20typical%20discovery-to-service%20latencies%20of%20just%20a%20few%20seconds.%20In%20terms%20of%20scale%20and%20availability,%20the%20development%20of%20Omid%20was%20largely%20driven%20by%20Sieve%E2%80%99s%20requirements.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESieve%20ingests%20a%20variety%20of%20content%20channels%20(e.g.,%20web%20crawl,%20social%20feeds,%20and%20proprietary%20sources)%20and%20applies%20custom%20workflows%20to%20generate%20data%20artifacts%20for%20target%20applications%20(e.g.,%20search%20indices).%C2%A0In%20this%20context,%20data%20is%20streamed%20through%20processing%20tasks%20that%20can%20form%20complex%20topologies.%20Each%20task%20consumes%20one%20or%20more%20data%20items%20and%20produces%20one%20or%20more%20new%20items.%20For%20example,%20the%20document%20processing%20task%20for%20Web%20search%20consumes%20an%20HTML%20page%E2%80%99s%20content%20and%20produces%20multiple%20new%20features%20for%20this%20page%20(term%20postings,%20hyperlinks,%20clickable%20text%20phrases%20named%20anchortext,%20and%20more).%20The%20subsequent%20link%20analysis%20task%20consumes%20the%20set%20of%20links%20for%20a%20given%20page%20and%20produces%20a%20reverse%20anchortext%20index%20for%20all%20link%20targets.%20%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESieve%20stores%20and%20processes%20billions%20of%20items.%20Thousands%20of%20tasks%20execute%20concurrently%20as%20the%20processed%20data%20streams%20through%20the%20system%20(resulting%20in%20tens%20of%20thousands%20of%20transactions/sec).%20All%20tasks%20read%20and%20write%20(typically)%20their%20artifacts%20from%20a%20multi-petabyte%20shared%20HBase%20instance.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESince%20the%20execution%20of%20individual%20tasks%20is%20completely%20uncoordinated,%20it%20is%20paramount%20to%20ensure%20that%20each%20task%20executes%20as%20a%20logically%20indivisible%20(atomic)%20unit,%20in%20isolation%20from%20other%20units,%20with%20predictable%20(consistent)%20results.%20Manually%20handling%20all%20possible%20race%20conditions%20and%20failure%20scenarios%20that%20could%20arise%20in%20a%20concurrent%20execution%20is%20prohibitively%20complex.%20Sieve%20developers%20therefore%20require%20a%20programming%20model%20that%20would%20allow%20them%20to%20focus%20on%20business%20logic%20rather%20than%20on%20system%20reliability%20and%20consistency%20issues.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOmid%20provides%20precisely%20this%20building%20block.%20It%20offers%20an%20easy-to-use%20API%20with%20sound%20and%20well-understood%20semantics.%20From%20an%20operations%20perspective,%20Omid%20is%20easy-to-administer,%20highly%20available,%20and%20highly%20scalable,%20and%20hence%20a%20natural%20technology%20choice%20for%20business-critical%20service%20like%20Sieve.%20%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EA%20Quick%20Tutorial%C2%A0%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETransaction%20processing%20systems%20offer%20application%20developers%20the%20well-known%20begin%20and%20commit%20APIs%20to%20mark%20transaction%20boundaries.%20An%20application%20can%20also%20abort%20a%20non-committed%20transaction,%20e.g.,%20in%20response%20to%20an%20error%20situation.%20All%20database%20reads%20and%20writes%20in%20the%20scope%20of%20a%20committed%20transaction%20appear%20to%20execute%20atomically;%20all%20reads%20and%20writes%20in%20the%20scope%20of%20an%20aborted%20transaction%20seem%20to%20have%20never%20happened.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20are%20now%20ready%20to%20tip-toe%20into%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20API,%20and%20see%20a%20simple%20code%20snippet.%20All%20you%20need%20to%20know%20is%20two%20interfaces%20-%20TransactionManager%20and%20TTable.%20TransactionManager%20handles%20all%20control%20operations%20(begin(),%20commit(),%20and%20abort())%20on%20behalf%20of%20the%20application.%20In%20this%20context,%20TransactionManager.begin()%20returns%20a%20unique%20transaction%20id%20(txid),%20to%20be%20used%20in%20subsequent%20calls.%20TTable%20is%20a%20transactional%20equivalent%20of%20HBase%E2%80%99s%20HTable.%20It%20augments%20HTable%E2%80%99s%20data%20access%20methods%20(get(),%20scan(),%20put(),%20and%20delete())%20with%20the%20txid%20parameter,%20to%20convey%20the%20transaction%E2%80%99s%20context.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20following%20example%20demonstrates%20how%20to%20use%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20transactional%20API%20to%20modify%20two%20rows%20in%20an%20HBase%20table%20with%20ACID%20guarantees,%20which%20it%E2%80%99s%20not%20possible%20with%20the%20standard%20HBase%20API.%20We%20assume%20prior%20HBase%20programming%20experience.%20For%20background,%20please%20see%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://hbase.apache.org/book.html%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3EHBase%20programming%20manual%3C/a%3E.%20%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EOmid%20Code%20Example%3C/b%3E%3Ci%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/i%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ci%3EConfiguration%20conf%20=%20HBaseConfiguration.create();%3Cbr/%3ETransactionManager%20tm%20=%20HBaseTransactionManager.newBuilder()%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0.withConfiguration(conf)%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0.build();%3Cbr/%3ETTable%20tt%20=%20new%20TTable(conf,%20&ldquo;EXAMPLE_TABLE&rdquo;);%3Cbr/%3E%3Cbr/%3Ebyte[]%20family%20=%20Bytes.toBytes(&ldquo;EXAMPLE_CF&rdquo;);%3Cbr/%3Ebyte[]%20qualifier%20=%20Bytes.toBytes(&ldquo;EXAMPLE_QUAL&rdquo;);%3Cbr/%3E%3Cbr/%3ETransaction%20tx%20=%20tm.begin();%3Cbr/%3EPut%20row1%20=%20new%20Put(Bytes.toBytes(&ldquo;EXAMPLE_ROW1&rdquo;));%3Cbr/%3Erow1.add(family,%20qualifier,%20Bytes.toBytes(&ldquo;VALUE_1&rdquo;));%3Cbr/%3Ett.put(tx,%20row1);%3Cbr/%3EPut%20row2%20=%20new%20Put(Bytes.toBytes(&ldquo;EXAMPLE_ROW2&rdquo;));%3Cbr/%3Erow2.add(family,%20qualifier,%20Bytes.toBytes(&ldquo;VALUE_2&rdquo;));%3Cbr/%3Ett.put(tx,%20row2);%3Cbr/%3Etm.commit(tx);%3Cbr/%3E%3Cbr/%3Ett.close();%3Cbr/%3Etm.close();%3C/i%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/blockquote%3E%3Cp%3EPlease%20refer%20to%20this%20github%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/omid/wiki/Basic-Examples%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Epage%20%3C/a%3Efor%20more%20code%20examples.%C2%A0%20%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EA%20Case%20for%20Snapshot%20Isolation%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20%E2%80%9CI%E2%80%9D%20in%20ACID%20is%20for%20Isolation%20-%20preventing%20concurrently%20executing%20transactions%20from%20seeing%20each%20other%E2%80%99s%20partial%20updates.%20The%20isolation%20property%20is%20essential%20for%20consistency.%20Informally,%20it%20ensures%20that%20the%20information%20a%20transaction%20reads%20from%20the%20database%20%E2%80%9Cmakes%20sense%E2%80%9D%20in%20that%20it%20does%20not%20mix%20old%20and%20new%20values.%20For%20example,%20if%20a%20Sieve%20transaction%20updates%20the%20reverse-anchortext%20feature%20of%20multiple%20pages%20linked-to%20by%20the%20page%20being%20processed,%20then%20no%20concurrent%20transaction%20may%20observe%20the%20old%20value%20of%20that%20%C2%A0feature%20for%20some%20of%20these%20pages%20and%20the%20new%20value%20for%20the%20rest.%20%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EMore%20formally,%20a%20system%20satisfies%20a%20consistency%20model%20if%20every%20externally%20observable%20execution%20history%20can%20be%20explained%20as%20a%20sequence%20of%20legal%20database%20state%20transitions.%20Omid%20employs%20an%20intuitive%20yet%20scalable%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=69541%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3ESnapshot%20Isolation%20%3C/a%3Emodel%20to%20guarantee%20data%20consistency%20when%20multiple%20concurrent%20transactions%20access%20the%20same%20data%20elements.%C2%A0This%20is%20implemented%20in%20popular%20database%20technologies%20such%20as%20Oracle,%20PostgreSQL,%20and%20Microsoft%20SQL%20Server.%20Explaining%20this%20design%20choice%20requires%20a%20small%20detour%20into%20history,%20and%20can%20be%20skipped%20in%20the%20first%20reading.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOver%20the%20years,%20the%20database%20community%20studied%20several%20transaction%20isolation%20models.%20The%20most%20intuitive%20one%20is%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serializability%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Eserializability%3C/a%3E%20-%20a%20guarantee%20that%20the%20outcome%20of%20any%20parallel%20execution%20of%20transactions%20can%20be%20explained%20by%20some%20serial%20order.%20In%20other%20words,%20transactions%20seem%20to%20be%20executing%20sequentially%20without%20overlapping%20in%20time%20(or%20alternatively,%20every%20transaction%20can%20be%20reduced%20to%20a%20point%20in%20time%20when%20it%20takes%20effect).%20Serializability%20implementations%20were%20traditionally%20based%20on%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two-phase_locking%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Etwo-phase%20locking%3C/a%3E%20methods%20that%20date%20back%20to%20the%2070%E2%80%99s.%20While%20offering%20an%20extremely%20simple%20abstraction,%20serializable%20systems%20have%20been%20shown%20to%20suffer%20from%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1376713%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Esignificant%20performance%20bottlenecks%20%3C/a%3Edue%20to%20their%20lock-based%20concurrency%20control.%20Since%20the%20mid-90%E2%80%99s,%20researchers%20set%20out%20on%20a%20quest%20for%20models%20that%20translate%20to%20scalable%20implementations.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EA%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=69541%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Eseminal%20paper%20by%20Bernstein%20et%20al.%3C/a%3E%20suggested%20a%20new%20model,%20named%20Snapshot%20Isolation%20(SI),%20which%20relaxes%20the%20correctness%20criteria%20of%20serializability%20&ndash;%20most%20applications%20do%20not%20require%20such%20a%20strict%20correctness%20criteria%20&ndash;%20and%20it%20is%20suitable%20for%20lock-free%20implementations.%20In%20a%20nutshell,%20SI%20allows%20transactions%20to%20be%20reduced%20to%20two%20points%20instead%20of%20one:%20a%20reading%20point%20and%20a%20writing%20point.%20Inconsistent%20reads%20do%20not%20occur,%20since%20each%20transaction%20sees%20a%20consistent%20snapshot%20of%20the%20database.%20This%20means%20that%20for%20two%20concurrent%20transactions%20T1%20and%20T2,%20T1%20sees%20either%20all%20of%20T2%E2%80%99s%20updates%20to%20data%20items%20it%20is%20reading,%20or%20none%20of%20T2%E2%80%99s%20updates.%20SI%20guarantees%20that%20(1)%20all%20reads%20in%20a%20transaction%20see%20a%20consistent%20snapshot%20of%20the%20database,%20and%20(2)%20a%20transaction%20successfully%20commits%20only%20if%20no%20update%20it%20has%20made%20conflicts%20with%20any%20concurrent%20updates%20made%20since%20that%20snapshot.%20As%20stated%20before,%20while%20SI%20is%20slightly%20different%20from%20serializability%20in%20terms%20of%20correctness%20(e.g.%20SI%20does%20not%20avoid%20the%20write-skew%20anomaly),%20SI%20implementations%20offer%20a%20better%20performance%20than%20strict%20serializability%20implementations.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20diagram%20below%20illustrates%20snapshot%20isolation.%20In%20simple%20terms,%20two%20transactions%20conflict%20under%20SI%20if%20and%20only%20if:%201)%20they%20execute%20concurrently%20(overlap%20in%20time);%20and%202)%20write%20to%20the%20same%20element%20of%20a%20particular%20row%20(spatial%20overlap).%20Here,%20transactions%20T1%20and%20T2%20overlap%20in%20time%20but%20not%20in%20space%20(their%20write%20sets%20do%20not%20contain%20modifications%20on%20the%20same%20items),%20therefore%20they%20can%20both%20commit.%20T2%20and%20T3%20overlap%20in%20time%20and%20in%20space%20(both%20write%20to%20R4),%20therefore%20one%20of%20them%20must%20be%20aborted%20to%20avoid%20consistency%20violation.%20T4%20on%20the%20other%20hand,%20does%20not%20overlap%20any%20other%20transaction%20in%20time%20and%20can%20therefore%20commit.%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%20data-orig-height=%22305%22%20data-orig-width=%22720%22%3E%3Cimg%20data-orig-height=%22305%22%20data-orig-width=%22720%22%20alt=%22image%22%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/ee6ee99354e0ef5e89ccf1eb42a7e9cc/tumblr_inline_nuj98tx4G91t17fny_540.jpg%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3ESnapshot%20isolation%20is%20amenable%20to%20scalable%20implementations.%20NoSQL%20datastores%20that%20support%20multi-version%20concurrency%20control%20(MVCC),%20namely%20storing%20multiple%20versions%20capturing%20the%20history%20of%20an%20item%20associated%20with%20a%20unique%20key,%20are%20suitable%20for%20implementing%20SI.%20In%20such%20a%20system,%20transactions%20read%20data%20via%20immutable%20snapshots%20based%20on%20historic%20versions,%20and%20write%20data%20by%20creating%20new%20versions.%20Therefore,%20reads%20and%20writes%20need%20no%20coordination.%20Furthermore,%20writes%20can%20proceed%20without%20coordinating%20with%20concurrent%20transactions%20until%20they%20attempt%20to%20commit,%20at%20which%20time%20inter-transaction%20order%20is%20established%20and%20conflicts%20are%20detected.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EFortunately,%20HBase%20is%20natively%20multi-versioned,%20whereby%20clients%20can%20control%20version%20numbers%20(timestamps)%20and%20retrieve%20data%20through%20snapshots%20associated%20with%20a%20given%20timestamp.%20While%20this%20API%20is%20complex%20to%20use%20in%20regular%20applications,%20it%20is%20a%20perfect%20fit%20for%20Omid,%20which%20exploits%20it%20to%20provide%20a%20simple%20and%20clean%20SI%20abstraction.%20We%20leave%20the%20implementation%20details%20for%20future%20posts.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EAcknowledgement%C2%A0%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20would%20like%20to%20acknowledge%20all%20the%20contributions%20to%20Omid,%20as%20concept%20and%20code,%20since%20its%20early%20days.%20Our%20thanks%20go%20to%20Daniel%20Gomez%20Ferro,%20Eshcar%20Hillel,%20Flavio%20Junqueira,%20Idit%20Keidar,%20Ivan%20Kelly,%20Francis%20Christopher%20Liu,%20Matthieu%20Morel,%20Benjamin%20(Ben)%20Reed,%20Ohad%20Shacham,%20Maysam%20Yabandeh,%20and%20the%20whole%20Sieve%20team.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ESummary%C2%A0%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThis%20post%20introduced%20Omid,%20an%20open-source%20transaction%20processing%20system%20for%20HBase.%20We%20presented%20a%20web-scale%20application%20at%20Yahoo%20for%20which%20Omid%20is%20a%20critical%20building%20block,%20saw%20a%20simple%20code%20snippet%20that%20exercises%20Omid,%20and%20finally,%20discussed%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20snapshot%20isolation%20model%20for%20preserving%20data%20consistency.%20Our%20next%20post%20in%20this%20series%20will%20provide%20an%20overview%20of%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20architecture%20and%20administration%20basics.%20%3C/p%3E,http://yahoohadoop.tumblr.com/post/129089878751
mailto:?subject=Introducing%20Proxy%20Verifier%20-%20Open%20Source%20Tool%20for%20Testing%20HTTP%20Based%20Proxies&body=%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/alan-m-carroll-b128623%22%3EAlan%20M.%20Carroll%3C/a%3E%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/brian-neradt-0a14924/%22%3EBrian%20Neradt%3C/a%3E,%20Software%20Engineers,%20Verizon%20Media%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%E2%80%99re%20pleased%20to%20announce%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/proxy-verifier%22%3EProxy%20Verifier%3C/a%3E%20-%20an%20open%20source%20tool%20for%20testing%20HTTP%20based%20proxies.%20Originally%20built%20as%20part%20of%20Verizon%20Media%E2%80%99s%20support%20for%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://trafficserver.apache.org%22%3EApache%20Traffic%20Server%3C/a%3E%20(ATS)%20to%20improve%20testability%20and%20reliability,%20Proxy%20Verifier%20generates%20traffic%20through%20a%20proxy%20and%20verifies%20the%20behavior%20of%20the%20proxy.%20A%20key%20difference%20between%20Proxy%20Verifier%20and%20existing%20HTTP%20based%20test%20tools%20is%20Proxy%20Verifier%20verifies%20traffic%20to%20and%20from%20the%20proxy.%20This%20bi-directional%20ability%20was%20a%20primary%20motivation.%20In%20addition,%20handling%20traffic%20on%20both%20sides%20of%20the%20proxy%20means%20a%20Proxy%20Verifier%20setup%20can%20run%20in%20a%20network%20disconnected%20environment,%20which%20was%20an%20absolute%20requirement%20for%20this%20work%20-%20no%20other%20servers%20are%20required,%20and%20the%20risk%20of%20hitting%20production%20servers%20with%20test%20traffic%20is%20eliminated.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAfter%20sharing%20the%20idea%20for%20Proxy%20Verifier%20with%20the%20Apache%20Traffic%20Server%20community,%20we%E2%80%99ve%20received%20significant%20external%20interest.%20We%20are%20pleased%20to%20have%20achieved%20a%20level%20of%20maturity%20with%20the%20tool%E2%80%99s%20development%20that%20we%20can%20now%20share%20it%20with%20the%20world%20by%20open%20sourcing%20it.%20As%20a%20related%20benefit,%20by%20open%20sourcing%20Proxy%20Verifier%20we%20will%20also%20be%20able%20to%20use%20it%20as%20a%20part%20of%20Traffic%20Server%E2%80%99s%20end-to-end%20test%20automation.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWithin%20Verizon%20Media,%20Proxy%20Verifier%20serves%20to%20support%20correctness,%20production%20simulation,%20and%20load%20testing.%20Generated%20and%20captured%20replay%20files%20are%20used%20for%20production%20simulation%20and%20load%20testing.%20Handbuilt%20replay%20files%20are%20used%20for%20debugging%20and%20correctness%20testing.%20Replay%20files%20are%20easily%20constructed%20by%20hand%20based%20on%20use%20cases%20or%20packet%20capture%20files,%20and%20also%20easily%20edited%20and%20extended%20later.%20Proxy%20Verifier%20is%20being%20integrated%20into%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://bitbucket.org/autestsuite/reusable-gold-testing-system/src/master/%22%3EAuTest%20framework%3C/a%3E%20used%20in%20ATS%20for%20automated%20end-to-end%20testing.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EProxy%20Verifier%20builds%20two%20executables,%20the%20client%20and%20server,%20which%20are%20used%20to%20test%20the%20proxy:%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221378%22%20data-orig-height=%22392%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/c729047bc3af58e4a30339cc8311e2b0/2ca4991e6f659b8b-e0/s540x810/37126d81e602823b3f1ece1eae089a38b44cc40f.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221378%22%20data-orig-height=%22392%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20client%20sends%20requests%20to%20the%20proxy%20under%20test,%20which%20in%20turn%20is%20configured%20to%20send%20them%20to%20the%20server.%20The%20server%20parses%20the%20request%20from%20the%20proxy,%20sends%20a%20response,%20which%20the%20proxy%20then%20sends%20to%20the%20client.%20This%20traffic%20is%20controlled%20by%20a%20%E2%80%9Creplay%20file%E2%80%9D,%20which%20is%20a%20YAML%20formatted%20configuration%20file.%20This%20contains%20the%20transactions%20as%20four%20messages%20-%20client%20to%20proxy,%20proxy%20to%20server,%20server%20to%20proxy,%20and%20proxy%20to%20client.%20%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETransactions%20can%20be%20grouped%20into%20sessions,%20each%20of%20which%20represents%20a%20single%20connection%20from%20the%20client%20to%20the%20proxy.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThis%20set%20of%20events%20are%20depicted%20in%20the%20following%20sequence%20diagram:%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221456%22%20data-orig-height=%221242%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/e1b3928731a3afe587913b2663c15801/2ca4991e6f659b8b-ca/s540x810/2de5801691f0bc99aef3132bf2e3702aa5722037.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221456%22%20data-orig-height=%221242%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EBecause%20the%20Proxy%20Verifier%20server%20needs%20only%20the%20replay%20file%20and%20no%20other%20configuration,%20it%20is%20easy%20for%20a%20developer%20to%20use%20it%20as%20a%20test%20HTTP%20server%20instead%20of%20setting%20up%20and%20configuring%20a%20full%20web%20server.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOther%20key%20features:%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3EFine-grained%20control%20of%20what%20is%20sent%20from%20the%20client%20and%20server,%20along%20with%20what%20is%20expected%20from%20the%20proxy.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3ESpecific%20fields%20in%20the%20proxy%20request%20or%20response%20can%20be%20checked%20against%20one%20of%20three%20criteria:%20the%20presence%20of%20a%20field,%20the%20absence%20of%20a%20field,%20or%20the%20presence%20of%20a%20field%20with%20a%20specific%20value.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3ETransactions%20in%20the%20config%20can%20be%20run%20once%20or%20repeatedly%20a%20specified%20number%20of%20times.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3ESessions%20allow%20control%20of%20how%20much%20a%20client%20session%20is%20reused.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3ETransactions%20can%20be%20sent%20at%20a%20fixed%20rate%20to%20help%20simulate%20production%20level%20loads.%20Proxy%20Verifier%20has%20been%20tested%20up%20to%20over%2010K%20RPS%20sustained.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EThe%20&ldquo;traffic_dump&rdquo;%20plugin%20for%20ATS%20can%20be%20used%20to%20capture%20production%20traffic%20for%20later%20testing%20with%20Proxy%20Verifier.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EProtocol%20support:%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3EIPv4%20and%20IPv6%20support.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EHTTP/1.x%20support%20for%20both%20the%20Verifier%20client%20and%20server.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EThe%20Verifier%20client%20supports%20HTTP/2%20but%20the%20server%20currently%20does%20not.%20We%20have%20plans%20to%20support%20server-side%20HTTP/2%20sometime%20before%20the%20end%20of%20Q2%202020.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EHTTPS%20with%20TLS%201.3%20support%20(assuming%20Proxy%20Verifier%20is%20linked%20against%20OpenSSL%201.1.1%20or%20higher).%C2%A0%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp%3EFor%20build%20and%20installation%20instructions,%20explore%20the%20github%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/proxy-verifier%22%3EREADME%3C/a%3E%20page.%20Please%20file%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/proxy-verifier/issues%22%3Egithub%20issues%3C/a%3E%20for%20bugs%20or%20enhancement%20requests.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EAcknowledgments%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20would%20like%20to%20thank%20several%20people%20whose%20work%20contributed%20to%20this%20project:%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3ESyeda%20%E2%80%9CPersia%E2%80%9D%20Aziz,%20initial%20work%20and%20proof%20of%20concept%20for%20the%20replay%20server.%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EJesse%20Zhang,%20previous%20generation%20prototype%20and%20the%20schema.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EWill%20Wendorf,%20initial%20verification%20logic.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3ESusan%20Hinrichs,%20implemented%20the%20client%20side%20HTTP/2%20support.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E,https://yahoodevelopers.tumblr.com/post/611510553547030528
mailto:?subject=Introducing%20Queue%20Service&body=%3Cp%3EPritam%20Paul,%20Software%20Engineer,%20Verizon%20Media%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20have%20recently%20made%20changes%20to%20the%20underlying%20Screwdriver%20Architecture%20for%20build%20processing.%20Previously,%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/screwdriver-cd/executor-queue%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/screwdriver-cd/executor-queue%22%3Eexecutor-queue%3C/a%3E%20was%20tightly-coupled%20to%20the%20SD%20API%20and%20worked%20by%20constantly%20polling%20for%20messages%20at%20specific%20intervals.%20Due%20to%20this%20design,%20the%20queue%20would%20block%20API%20requests.%20Furthermore,%20if%20the%20API%20crashed,%20scheduled%20jobs%20might%20not%20be%20added%20to%20the%20queue,%20causing%20cascading%20failures.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EHence,%20keeping%20the%20principles%20of%20isolation-of-concerns%20and%20abstraction%20in%20mind,%20we%20designed%20a%20more%20resilient%C2%A0REST-API-based%20queueing%20system:%20the%20Queue%20Service.%20This%20new%20service%20reads,%20writes%20and%20deletes%20messages%20from%20the%20queue%20after%20processing.%20It%20also%20encompasses%20the%20former%20capability%20of%20the%C2%A0%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/screwdriver-cd/queue-worker%22%3Equeue-worker%3C/a%3E%20and%20acts%20as%20a%20scheduler.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3EAuthentication%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20SD%20API%20and%20Queue%20Service%20communicate%20bidirectionally%20using%20signed%20JWT%20tokens%20sent%20via%20auth%20headers%20of%20each%20request.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3EBuild%20Sequence%3C/h2%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%223038%22%20data-orig-height=%221129%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/d77f8f1c5b3c22d0c49a87c95477395e/625eb863e88bf54d-55/s540x810/0265a1a11f1d9bf6129bfa1904ec8e2d8cbd7f53.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%223038%22%20data-orig-height=%221129%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Ch2%3EDesign%20Document%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EFor%20more%20details,%20check%20out%20our%20%3Ca%20href=%22 .%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EYChaos%20Agents%20are%20designed%20in%20such%20a%20way%20that%20it%20is%20possible%20to%20run%20them%20independently%20without%20any%20intermediates%20like%20a%20coordinator.%20This%20helps%20in%20quick%20development%20and%20testing%20of%20agents.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAgents%20follow%20a%20sequence%20in%20their%20execution%20called%20the%20lifecycle%20methods%20like%20setup,%20run,%20teardown%20and%20monitor.%20The%20setup%20initializes%20the%20prerequisites%20for%20an%20agent%20to%20execute.%20Run%20actually%20contains%20the%20program%20logic%20required%20to%20perform%20a%20chaos%20on%20the%20system.%20Once%20the%20run%20executes%20successfully,%20the%20teardown%20can%20be%20triggered%20to%20restore%20back%20the%20system%20from%20the%20chaos%20created%20by%20that%20particular%20agent.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3EAcknowledgement%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20would%20like%20to%20thank%20all%20the%20contributors%20to%20YChaos%20as%20an%20idea,%20concept%20or%20code.%20We%20extend%20our%20gratitude%20to%20all%20those%20supporting%20the%20project%20from%20&ldquo;Gru&rdquo;%20to%20&ldquo;YChaos&rdquo;.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3ESummary%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EThis%20post%20introduced%20a%20new%20Chaos%20Engineering%20or%20Resilience%20testing%20tool%20YChaos,%20how%20to%20get%20started%20with%20it%20and%20briefly%20discussed%20the%20design%20and%20architecture%20of%20the%20components%20that%20make%20up%20YChaos%20along%20with%20some%20quick%20examples%20to%20start%20your%20journey%20with%20YChaos%20with.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3EReferences%20and%20Links%3C/h2%3E%3Col%3E%20%20%20%20%3Cli%3EYChaos%20Codebase%20:%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/ychaos%22%3Ehttps://github.com/yahoo/ychaos%3C/a%3E%3C/li%3E%20%20%20%20%3Cli%3EYChaos%20Documentation%20:%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://yahoo.github.io/ychaos%22%3Ehttps://yahoo.github.io/ychaos%3C/a%3E%3C/li%3E%20%20%20%20%3Cli%3EOur%20Presence%20on%20PyPi%3C/li%3E%20%20%20%20%3Col%3E%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://test.pypi.org/project/ychaos/%22 %20scales%20further%20with%20the%20number%20of%20GPUs.%20For%20top-5%20accuracy%2060%%20(40%%20error),%208%20GPUs%20achieved%20680%%20speedup%20over%201%20GPU.%20Table%20below%20also%20shows%20the%20speedup%20for%20top-5%20accuracy%2070%%20and%2080%.%20The%20speedup%20could%20be%20larger%20if%20we%20adjust%20batch%20size%20carefully%20(instead%20of%20total%20batch%20size%2032n).%C2%A0%20%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22716%22%20data-orig-height=%22375%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/cc7cf8535ae707c9ca8a6cc5b759ee8d/tumblr_inline_nv96ui5Tod1t17fny_540.jpg%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22716%22%20data-orig-height=%22375%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EOpen%20Source%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EContinuing%20Yahoo%E2%80%99s%20commitment%20to%20open%20source,%20we%20have%20released%20some%20of%20our%20code%20into%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/BVLC/caffe%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Egithub.com/BVLC/caffe%3C/a%3E:%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/pull/2114%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E#2114%3C/a%3E%20%E2%80%A6%20Allow%20Caffe%20to%20use%20multiple%20GPUs%20within%20a%20computer%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/pull/1148%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E#1148%3C/a%3E%20%E2%80%A6%20RDMA%20transfers%20across%20computers%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/pull/2386%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E#2386%3C/a%3E%20%E2%80%A6%20Improved%20Caffe%E2%80%99s%20data%20pipeline%20and%20prefetching%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/pull/2395%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E#2395%3C/a%3E%20%E2%80%A6%20Added%20timing%20information%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/pull/2402%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E#2402%3C/a%3E%20%E2%80%A6%20Make%20Caffe%E2%80%99s%20IO%20dependencies%20optional%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/pull/2397%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E#2397%3C/a%3E%20%E2%80%A6% %3Ccode%3Erank-features%3C/code%3E%20keyword,%20as%20shown%20below.%20The%20%3Ccode%3Erandom%3C/code%3E%20first%20phase%20will%20be%20used%20when%20sampling%20random%20documents%20to%20serve%20as%20a%20proxy%20to%20non-relevant%20documents.%3C/p%3E%3Cpre%3Erank-profile%20collect_rank_features%20inherits%20default%20{%3Cbr/%3E%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0first-phase%20{%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0expression:%20random%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0}%3Cbr/%3E%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0ignore-default-rank-features%3Cbr/%3E%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0rank-features%20{%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0bm25(title)%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0bm25(body)%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0nativeRank(title)%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0nativeRank(body)%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0}%3Cbr/%3E%3Cbr/%3E}%3C/pre%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20want%20a%20dataset%20that%20will%20help%20train%20models%20that%20will%20generalize%20well%20when%20running%20on%20a%20Vespa%20instance.%20This%20implies%20that%20we%20are%20only%20interested%20in%20collecting%20documents%20that%20are%20matched%20by%20the%20query%20because%20those%20are%20the%20documents%20that%20would%20be%20presented%20to%20the%20first-phase%20model%20in%20a%20production%20environment.%20Here%20is%20the%20data%20collection%20logic:%3C/p%3E%3Cpre%3Ehits%20=%20get_relevant_hit(query,%20rank_profile,%20relevant_id)%3Cbr/%3Eif%20relevant_hit:%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0hits.extend(get_random_hits(query,%20rank_profile,%20n_samples))%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0data%20=%20annotate_data(hits,%20query_id,%20relevant_id)%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0append_data(file,%20data)%3C/pre%3E%3Cp%3EFor%20each%20query,%20we%20first%20send%20a%20request%20to%20Vespa%20to%20get%20the%20relevant%20document%20associated%20with%20the%20query.%20If%20the%20relevant%20document%20is%20matched%20by%20the%20query,%20Vespa%20will%20return%20it%20and%20we%20will%20expand%20the%20number%20of%20documents%20associated%20with%20the%20query%20by%20sending%20a%20second%20request%20to%20Vespa.%20The%20second%20request%20asks%20Vespa%20to%20return%20a%20number%20of%20random%20documents%20sampled%20from%20the%20set%20of%20documents%20that%20were%20matched%20by%20the%20query.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20then%20parse%20the%20hits%20returned%20by%20Vespa%20and%20organize%20the%20data%20into%20a%20tabular%20form%20containing%20the%20rank%20features%20and%20the%20binary%20variable%20indicating%20if%20the%20query-document%20pair%20is%20relevant%20or%20not.%20At%20the%20end%20we%20have%20a%20dataset%20with%20the%20following%20format.%20More%20details%20can%20be%20found%20in%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/tutorials/text-search-ml.html%22%3Eour%20second%20tutorial%3C/a%3E.%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%20data-orig-height=%22268%22%20data-orig-width=%221324%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/5add0b2f89dc17281a50e15c91bc4c68/60c7799dba94b2e9-b4/s540x810/27eb0eb7626c85140d8596d0a82c9dd8b5a558fe.png%22%20data-orig-height=%22268%22%20data-orig-width=%221324%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Ch2%3EBeyond%20pointwise%20loss%20functions%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20most%20straightforward%20way%20to%20train%20the%20linear%20model%20suggested%20in%20our%20data%20collection%20sanity%20check%20would%20be%20to%20use%20a%20vanilla%20logistic%20regression,%20since%20our%20target%20variable%20%3Ccode%3Erelevant%3C/code%3E%20is%20binary.%20The%20most%20commonly%20used%20loss%20function%20in%20this%20case%20(binary%20cross-entropy)%20is%20referred%20to%20as%20a%20pointwise%20loss%20function%20in%20the%20LTR%20literature,%20as%20it%20does%20not%20take%20the%20relative%20order%20of%20documents%20into%20account.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EHowever,%20as%20we%20described%20in%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/tutorials/text-search.html%22%3Eour%20first%20tutorial%3C/a%3E,%20the%20metric%20that%20we%20want%20to%20optimize%20in%20this%20case%20is%20the%20Mean%20Reciprocal%20Rank%20(MRR).%20The%20MRR%20is%20affected%20by%20the%20relative%20order%20of%20the%20relevance%20we%20assign%20to%20the%20list%20of%20documents%20generated%20by%20a%20query%20and%20not%20by%20their%20absolute%20magnitudes.%20This%20disconnect%20between%20the%20characteristics%20of%20the%20loss%20function%20and%20the%20metric%20of%20interest%20might%20lead%20to%20suboptimal%20results.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EFor%20ranking%20search%20results,%20it%20is%20preferable%20to%20use%20a%20listwise%20loss%20function%20when%20training%20our%20model,%20which%20takes%20the%20entire%20ranked%20list%20into%20consideration%20when%20updating%20the%20model%20parameters.%20To%20illustrate%20this,%20we%20trained%20linear%20models%20using%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/tensorflow/ranking%22%3ETF-Ranking%20framework%3C/a%3E.%20The%20framework%20is%20built%20on%20top%20of%20TensorFlow%20and%20allow%20us%20to%20specify%20pointwise,%20pairwise%20and%20listwise%20loss%20functions,%20among%20other%20things.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/vespa-engine/sample-apps/tree/master/text-search%22%3Emade%20available%3C/a%3E%20the%20script%20that%20we%20used%20to%20train%20the%20two%20models%20that%20generated%20the%20results%20displayed%20in%20the%20figure%20below.%20The%20script%20uses%20simple%20linear%20models%20but%20can%20be%20useful%20as%20a%20starting%20point%20to%20build%20more%20complex%20ones.%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%20data-orig-height=%22700%22%20data-orig-width=%22650%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/6301c2c5d7015c9f8f8f824f4dd9440b/60c7799dba94b2e9-5e/s540x810/0280c78756d9a59068630a85ff30aad3876cdf97.png%22%20data-orig-height=%22700%22%20data-orig-width=%22650%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EOverall,%20on%20average,%20there%20is%20not%20much%20difference%20between%20those%20models%20(with%20respect%20to%20MRR),%20which%20was%20expected%20given%20the%20simplicity%20of%20the%20models%20described%20here.%20However,%20we%20can%20see%20that%20a%20model%20based%20on%20a%20listwise%20loss%20function%20allocate%20more%20documents%20in%20the%20first%20two%20positions%20of%20the%20ranked%20list%20when%20compared%20to%20the%20pointwise%20model.%20We%20expect%20the%20difference%20in%20MRR%20between%20pointwise%20and%20listwise%20loss%20functions%20to%20increase%20as%20we%20move%20on%20to%20more%20complex%20models.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20main%20goal%20here%20was%20simply%20to%20show%20the%20importance%20of%20choosing%20better%20loss%20functions%20when%20dealing%20with%20LTR%20tasks%20and%20to%20give%20a%20quick%20start%20for%20those%20who%20want%20to%20give%20it%20a%20shot%20in%20their%20own%20Vespa%20applications.%20Now,%20it%20is%20up%20to%20you,%20check%20out%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/tutorials/text-search.html%22%3Ethe%20tutorials%3C/a%3E,%20build%20something%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://twitter.com/vespaengine%22%3Elet%20us%20know%3C/a%3E%20how%20it%20went.%20Feedbacks%20are%20welcome!%3C/p%3E,https://blog.vespa.ai/post/189478730081

878751/introducing-omid-transaction-processing-for%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Eprevious%20blog%20post%3C/a%3E,%20Omid%20provides%20a%20lock-free%3Ca%20href=%22http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=69541%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%20Snapshot%20Isolation%3C/a%3E%20(SI)%20implementation%20that%20scales%20far%20better%20than%20traditional%20two-phase%20locking%20approaches.%20Namely,%20transactions%20can%20execute%20concurrently%20until%20commit,%20at%20which%20time%20write-write%20conflicts%20are%20resolved.%20Ties%20between%20two%20transactions%20that%20overlap%20both%20in%20time%20and%20in%20space%20(so%20committing%20both%20of%20them%20would%20violate%20SI)%20are%20broken%20by%20aborting%20one%20of%20them,%20usually%20the%20one%20that%20attempts%20to%20commit%20later.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20simplest%20way%20to%20break%20ties%20is%20via%20a%20central%20arbiter%20that%20serializes%20all%20commit%20requests%20and%20resolves%20conflicts%20based%20on%20this%20order.%20Distributed%20implementations,%20for%20example,%3Ca%20href=%22https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two-phase_commit_protocol%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%20two-phase%20commit%3C/a%3E,%20are%20more%20expensive,%20complex,%20and%20error-prone.%20Omid%20therefore%20takes%20the%20simpler,%20centralized%20approach.%20It%20employs%20a%20centralized%20management%20service%20for%20transactions,%20the%20Transaction%20Status%20Oracle,%20or%20TSO,%20which%20coordinates%20the%20actions%20of%20clients.%20The%20main%20task%20of%20the%20TSO%20is%20to%20detect%20write-write%20conflicts%20among%20concurrent%20transactions,%20as%20needed%20for%20ensuring%20SI%20semantics.%20Similarly%20to%20any%20centralized%20service,%20the%20TSO%20is%20vulnerable%20to%20becoming%20a%20single-point-of-failure%20and%20a%20performance%20bottleneck.%20We%20will%20discuss%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20approach%20to%20high%20availability%20(HA)%20and%20scalability%20in%20a%20forthcoming%20post.%20Here,%20we%20describe%20only%20the%20operation%20of%20a%20single%20TSO%20in%20failure-free%20scenarios.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOmid%20leverages%20the%20multi-versioning%20support%20in%20the%20underlying%20HBase%20key-value%20store,%20which%20allows%20transactions%20to%20read%20consistent%20snapshots%20of%20changing%20data%20as%20needed%20for%20SI.%20Specifically,%20when%20the%20item%20associated%20with%20an%20existing%20key%20is%20overwritten,%20a%20new%20version%20(holding%20the%20key,%20its%20new%20value,%20and%20a%20new%20version%20number)%20%C2%A0is%20created%20while%20the%20previous%20version%20persists.%20An%20old%20version%20might%20be%20required%20as%20long%20as%20there%20is%20some%20active%20transaction%20that%20had%20begun%20before%20the%20transaction%20that%20overwrote%20this%20version%20has%20committed.%20Though%20this%20may%20take%20a%20while,%20overwritten%20versions%20eventually%20become%20obsolete.%20Omid%20takes%20advantage%20of%20HBase%E2%80%99s%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://blogs.apache.org/hbase/entry/coprocessor_introduction%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Ecoprocessors%3C/a%3E%20to%20implement%20a%20garbage-collecting%20algorithm%3Ca%20href=%22https://blogs.apache.org/hbase/entry/coprocessor_introduction%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%20%3C/a%3Ein%20order%20to%20free%20up%20the%20disk%20space%20taken%20up%20by%20such%20obsolete%20versions%20when%20doing%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://hbase.apache.org/book.html#_compaction%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Ecompactions%3C/a%3E.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20addition%20to%20storing%20the%20application%20data,%20HBase%20is%20further%20used%20for%20persistent%20storage%20of%20transaction-related%20metadata,%20which%20is%20accessed%20only%20by%20the%20transactional%20API%20and%20not%20exposed%20to%20the%20user,%20as%20will%20be%20described%20shortly.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOne%20of%20the%20functions%20of%20the%20TSO%20is%20generating%20version%20numbers%20(timestamps)%20for%20all%20client%20transactions.%20This%20is%20achieved%20via%20a%20subcomponent,%20the%20so-called%20Timestamp%20Oracle,%20that%20implements%20a%20central%20logical%20clock.%20In%20order%20to%20preserve%20correctness%20in%20shutdown/restart%20scenarios,%20the%20Timestamp%20Oracle%20maintains%20an%20upper%20bound%20(maximum%20timestamp)%20of%20this%20clock%20in%20a%20reliable%20repository,%20which%20can%20be%20either%20an%20HBase%20table%20or%3Ca%20href=%22http://zookeeper.apache.org/%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%20a%20znode%20in%20Apache%20Zookeeper%3C/a%3E.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20following%20diagram%20summarizes%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20system%20components%20and%20the%20interactions%20among%20them.%20Note%20that%20the%20TSO%20is%20only%20involved%20in%20the%20control%20path%20(for%20transaction%20begin/commit/rollback),%20whereas%20the%20Omid%20clients%20interact%20with%20HBase%20directly%20in%20the%20data%20path.%20This%20separation%20is%20paramount%20for%20scalability.%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22975%22%20data-orig-height=%22586%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/6035e913dbc52cf97720db9e94227d1a/tumblr_inline_nxf311eCNN1t17fny_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22975%22%20data-orig-height=%22586%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ci%3E%3Cb%3EFig%201:%3C/b%3E%20Omid%20components.%20Omid%20clients%20use%20the%20TSO%20to%20create%20transactional%20contexts.%20Clients%20also%20allow%20to%20access%20data%20that%20resides%20in%20data%20tables%20in%20HBase%20transactionally.%20The%20TSO%20is%20in%20the%20control%20path%20for%20conflict%20detection%20when%20transactions%20are%20completed.%20Data%20is%20multi-versioned%20and%20a%20garbage-collecting%20coprocessor%20cleans%20up%20obsolete%20versions.%20The%20TSO%20and%20the%20Timestamp%20Oracle%20maintain%20some%20persistent%20and%20transient%20metadata%20in%20HBase%20(although%20it%20can%20be%20also%20stored%20in%20other%20storage%20systems).%3C/i%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/blockquote%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ci%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/i%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EData%20and%20Metadata%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAs%20noted%20above,%20user%20data%20resides%20in%20HBase%20and%20is%20multi-versioned.%20An%20item%E2%80%99s%20version%20number%20is%20the%20transaction%20identifier,%20txid,%20of%20the%20transaction%20that%20wrote%20it.%20The%20txid%20is%20returned%20by%20the%20TSO%20in%20response%20to%20a%20begin%20call.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOmid%20exploits%20HBase%20also%20for%20storing%20persistent%20metadata,%20which%20comes%20in%20two%20flavors.%20First,%20it%20augments%20each%20data%20item%20with%20a%20shadow%20cell,%20which%20indicates%20the%20commit%20status%20of%20the%20transaction%20that%20wrote%20it.%20Initially,%20when%20an%20item%20is%20written%20during%20a%20transaction,%20its%20shadow%20cell%20is%20set%20to%20tentative,%20i.e.,%20potentially%20uncommitted.%20At%20commit%20time,%20the%20client%20obtains%20from%20the%20TSO%20the%20transaction%E2%80%99s%20commit%20timestamp%20(commit%20ts)%20and%20writes%20this%20timestamp%20to%20the%20shadow%20cells%20of%20its%20writeset,%20which%20contains%20all%20the%20items%20written%20by%20the%20transaction.%20In%20addition,%20Omid%20manages%20a%20commit%20table%20(CT)%20tracking%20the%20commit%20timestamps%20of%20transactions.%20The%20data%20maintained%20in%20the%20CT%20is%20transient,%20being%20removed%20by%20the%20client%20when%20the%20transaction%20completes.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20diagram%20below%20summarizes%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20data%20model%20and%20flow.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22975%22%20data-orig-height=%22571%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/653dd4a7bfce7c03a63ad0189d0af5a5/tumblr_inline_nxf404JoUi1t17fny_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22975%22%20data-orig-height=%22571%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ci%3E%3Cb%3EFig%202:%3C/b%3E%20Omid%20data%20model.%20Clients%20use%20the%20TSO%20to%20obtain%20a%20transaction%20identifier%20(txid)%20when%20they%20begin%20a%20transaction,%20and%20a%20commit%20timestamp%20(commit%20ts)%20when%20they%20commit%20it.%20Data%20is%20stored%20in%20HBase%20with%20the%20txid%20as%20the%20version%20number,%20and%20the%20commit%20ts%20in%20a%20shadow%20cell.%20Before%20the%20commit%20ts%20is%20set,%20the%20written%20data%20is%20tentative,%20and%20the%20client%20consults%20the%20Commit%20Table%20to%20determine%20its%20status.%3C/i%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/blockquote%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ETransaction%20Protocol%20Overview%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cbr/%3EThe%20begin%20API%20produces%20a%20unique%20txid,%20which%20is%20used%20by%20all%20subsequent%20requests.%20%C2%A0In%20Omid,%20txid%20also%20serves%20as%20the%20read%20(snapshot)%20timestamp.%20The%20commit%20API%20produces%20a%20commit%20ts,%20which%20determines%20the%20transaction%E2%80%99s%20order%20in%20the%20sequence%20of%20committed%20transactions.%20Both%20timestamps%20are%20based%20on%20a%20logical%20clock%20maintained%20by%20the%20Timestamp%20Oracle.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ERecall%20from%20our%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://yahoohadoop.tumblr.com/post/129089878751/introducing-omid-transaction-processing-for%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Eprevious%20post%20%3C/a%3Ethat%20SI%20allows%20transactions%20to%20appear%20to%20execute%20all%20reads%20at%20one%20logical%20point%20and%20all%20writes%20at%20another%20(later)%20point.%20In%20Omid,%20the%20txid%20is%20the%20time%20of%20the%20logical%20clock%20when%20the%20transaction%20begins,%20and%20it%20determines%20which%20versions%20the%20transaction%20will%20read;%20the%20commit%20ts,%20on%20the%20other%20hand,%20is%20the%20logical%20time%20during%20commit,%20and%20all%20the%20transaction%E2%80%99s%20writes%20are%20associated%20with%20this%20time%20(via%20the%20shadow%20cells).%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESince%20transaction%20commit%20needs%20to%20be%20an%20atomic%20step,%20an%20application%20triggering%20a%20transaction:%20first%20tentatively%20writes%20all%20its%20information%20to%20data%20items%20without%20a%20commit%20timestamp%20in%20the%20corresponding%20shadow%20cells%20through%20the%20Omid%20client%20API%20(e.g.%20using%20transactional%20put%20or%20delete%20operations);%20then%20atomically%20commits%20it%20(in%20case%20there%20are%20no%20conflicts)%20via%20the%20TSO;%20and%20finally,%20once%20the%20client%20has%20received%20the%20commit%20ack%20from%20the%20TSO,%20it%20updates%20the%20shadow%20cells%20of%20these%20data%20items%20to%20include%20its%20commit%20ts.%20A%20transaction%20is%20considered%20complete%20once%20it%20finishes%20updating%20the%20shadow%20cells%20of%20all%20items%20in%20its%20writeset.%20Only%20at%20that%20point,%20the%20control%20is%20returned%20to%20the%20application.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20post-commit%20completion%20approach%20creates%20a%20window%20when%20the%20transaction%20is%20already%20committed%20but%20its%20writes%20are%20still%20tentative.%20However,%20a%20client%20may%20be%20delayed%20or%20even%20fail%20after%20committing%20a%20transaction%20and%20before%20completing%20it.%20Consider%20an%20incomplete%20committed%20transaction%20T.%20Transactions%20that%20begin%20during%20T%E2%80%99s%20completion%20phase%20obtain%20a%20txid%20that%20is%20larger%20than%20T%E2%80%99s%20commit%20ts,%20and%20yet%20during%20their%20operation,%20they%20may%20encounter%20in%20HBase%20data%20tables%20some%20items%20with%20tentative%20writes%20by%20T%20and%20others%20with%20complete%20writes%20by%20T.%20In%20order%20to%20ensure%20that%20such%20transactions%20see%20T%E2%80%99s%20updates%20consistently,%20Omid%20tracks%20the%20list%20of%20incomplete%20committed%20transactions%20in%20a%20persistent%20Commit%20Table%20(CT),%20which%20is%20also%20stored%20in%20HBase.%20Each%20entry%20in%20the%20CT%20maps%20a%20committed%20transaction%E2%80%99s%20id%20to%20its%20commit%20timestamp.%20The%20act%20of%20writing%20the%20(txid,%20commit%20ts)%20pair%20to%20the%20CT%20makes%20the%20transaction%20durable,%20regardless%20of%20subsequent%20client%20failures,%20and%20is%20considered%20the%20commit%20point%20of%20the%20transaction.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETransactions%20that%20encounter%20tentative%20writes%20during%20their%20reads%20refer%20to%20the%20CT%20in%20order%20to%20find%20out%20whether%20the%20value%20has%20been%20committed%20or%20not.%20In%20case%20it%20has,%20they%20help%20complete%20the%20write.%20This%20process%20is%20called%20healing,%20and%20is%20an%20optimization%20that%20might%20reduce%20accesses%20to%20the%20commit%20table%20by%20other%20transactions.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22950%22%20data-orig-height=%22736%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/3be4620a079c9733bba39d5d23774398/tumblr_inline_nxf4c9gjly1t17fny_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22950%22%20data-orig-height=%22736%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ci%3EFig%203:%C2%A0Omid%20Transaction%20Flow%20(TX%20=%20Transaction;%20TS=Timestamp)%3C/i%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/blockquote%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EClient-Side%20Operation%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20Omid%20client%20depicted%20in%20the%20previous%20figure%20executes%20the%20following%20actions%20in%20the%20name%20of%20a%20client%20application%20using%20transactions:%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ci%3EBegin:%3C/i%3E%20The%20client%20obtains%20from%20the%20TSO%20a%20start%20timestamp%20that%20exceeds%20all%20the%20write%20timestamps%20of%20committed%20transactions.%20This%20timestamp%20becomes%20the%20transaction%20identifier%20(%3Ci%3Etxid%3C/i%3E).%20%C2%A0It%20is%20also%20used%20to%20read%20the%20appropriate%20versions%20when%20reading%20data.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ci%3EGet(txid,%20key):%3C/i%3E%20The%20get%20operation%20performs%20the%20following%20actions%20(in%20pseudo-code):%3C/p%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3Cp%3Escan%20versions%20of%20key%20that%20are%20lower%20than%20%3Ci%3Etxid%3C/i%3E,%20highest%20to%20lowes
