it%20wrote%20to%20(so%20its%20writes%20are%20no%20longer%20tentative)%20and%20deletes%20the%20%3Ci%3Etxid%3C/i%3E%20entry%20from%20the%20CT.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ESummary%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAt%20Yahoo,%20we%20have%20recently%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/omid%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Eopen-sourced%20the%20Omid%20project%3C/a%3E,%20a%20transactional%20framework%20for%20HBase.%20In%20this%20blog%20post%20we%20discussed%20the%20architecture%20and%20protocols%20behind%20Omid.%20We%E2%80%99ve%20shown%20the%20main%20components%20involved%20and%20we%E2%80%99ve%20described%20their%20interactions,%20which%20enable%20our%20framework%20to%20provide%20transactions%20on%20top%20of%20HBase%20in%20an%20efficient%20and%20scalable%20manner.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20system%20has%20been%20implemented%20with%20HBase%20in%20mind,%20and%20therefore%20our%20presentation%20is%20in%20HBase%20terms.%20That%20said,%20the%20design%20principles%20are%20generic%20and%20database-neutral.%20Omid%20can%20be%20adapted%20to%20work%20with%20any%20persistent%20key-value%20store%20with%20multi-version%20concurrency%20control.%20%3C/p%3E,http://yahoohadoop.tumblr.com/post/132695603476

0to%20thousands%20of%20clients%20triggering%20transactions%20on%20application%20data.%20It&rsquo;s%20one%20of%20the%20few%20open-source%20transactional%20frameworks%20that%20can%20scale%20beyond%20100K%20transactions%20per%20second%20on%20mid-range%20hardware%20while%20incurring%20minimal%20impact%20on%20the%20latency%20accessing%20the%20datastore.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAt%20its%20core,%20Omid%20utilizes%20a%20lock-free%20approach%20to%20support%20multiple%20concurrent%20clients.%20Its%20design%20relies%20on%20a%20centralized%20conflict%20detection%20component%20called%20Transaction%20Status%20Oracle%20(TSO),%20which%20efficiently%20resolves%20write-set%20collisions%20among%20concurrent%20transactions%20[6].%20Another%20important%20benefit%20is%20that%20Omid%20does%20not%20require%20any%20modification%20of%20the%20underlying%20key-value%20datastore%20%E2%80%93%20HBase%20in%20this%20case.%20Moreover,%20the%20recently-added%20high-availability%20algorithm%20eliminates%20the%20single%20point%20of%20failure%20represented%20by%20the%20TSO%20in%20those%20deployments%20that%20require%20a%20higher%20degree%20of%20dependability%20[7].%20Last%20but%20not%20least,%20the%20API%20is%20very%20simple%20%E2%80%93%20mimicking%20the%20transaction%20manager%20APIs%20in%20the%20relational%20world:%20begin,%20commit,%20rollback%20%E2%80%93%20and%20the%20client%20and%20server%20configuration%20processes%20have%20been%20simplified%20to%20help%20both%20application%20developers%20and%20system%20administrators.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EEfforts%20toward%20growing%20the%20community%20have%20already%20been%20underway%20in%20the%20last%20few%20months.%20Apache%20Hive%20[8]%20contributors%20from%20Hortonworks%20expressed%20interest%20in%20storing%20Hive%20metadata%20in%20HBase%20using%20Omid,%20and%20this%20led%20to%20a%20fruitful%20collaboration%20that%20resulted%20in%20Omid%20now%20supporting%20HBase%201.x%20versions.%20Omid%20could%20also%20be%20used%20as%20the%20transaction%20ma 20to%20relying%20on%20IP%20and%20network%20ACL%20solutions%20that%20take%20time%20to%20propagate%20within%20a%20large%20system.%20Moreover,%20in%20very%20high-scale%20situations,%20you%20may%20run%20out%20of%20the%20limited%20number%20of%20network%20ACL%20rules%20that%20your%20hardware%20can%20support.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EPrior%20to%20creating%20Athenz,%20we%20had%20multiple%20ways%20of%20managing%20permissions%20and%20access%20control%20across%20all%20services%20within%20Yahoo.%20To%20simplify,%20we%20built%20a%20fine-grained,%20role-based%20authorization%20solution%20that%20would%20satisfy%20the%20feature%20and%20performance%20requirements%20our%20products%20demand.%20Athenz%20was%20built%20with%20open%20source%20in%20mind%20so%20as%20to%20share%20it%20with%20the%20community%20and%20further%20its%20development.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAt%20Yahoo,%20Athenz%20authorizes%20the%20dynamic%20creation%20of%20compute%20instances%20and%20containerized%20workloads,%20secures%20builds%20and%20deployment%20of%20their%20artifacts%20to%20our%20Docker%20registry,%20and%20among%20other%20uses,%20manages%20the%20data%20access%20from%20our%20centralized%20key%20management%20system%20to%20an%20authorized%20application%20or%20service.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAthenz%20provides%20a%20REST-based%20set%20of%20APIs%20modeled%20in%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=https%3A%2F%2Fardielle.github.io%2F&amp;t=OGVlZTI2NWEyOWU2MDMwN2ViNTA1YmRiZmJiY2NkOTI0Njk1NjQ0MyxUckI3WlZpOA%3D%3D&amp;b=t%3AHaiI2WONanJV7htKsFJyFw&amp;p=https%3A%2F%2Fathenz-rbac.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F160482404029%2Fopen-sourcing-athenz-fine-grained-role-based&amp;m=1%22%3EResource%20Description%20Language%20(RDL)%3C/a%3E%20to%20manage%20all%20aspects%20of%20the%20authorization%20system,%20and%20includes%20Java%20and%20Go%20client%20libraries%20to%20quickly%20and%20easily%20integrate%20your%20application%20with%20Athenz.%20It%20allows%20product%20administrators%20to%20manage%20what%20roles%20are%20allowed%20or%20denied%20to%20their%20applications%20or%20services%20in%20a%20centralized%20management%20system%20through%20a%20self-serve%20UI.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EAccess%20Control%20Models%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAthenz%20provides%20two%20authorization%20access%20control%20models%20based%20on%20your%20applications%E2%80%99%20or%20services%E2%80%99%20performance%20needs.%20More%20commonly%20used,%20the%20centralized%20access%20control%20model%20is%20ideal%20for%20provisioning%20and%20configuration%20needs.%20In%20instances%20where%20performance%20is%20absolutely%20critical%20for%20your%20applications%20or%20services,%20we%20provide%20a%20unique%20decentralized%20access%20control%20model%20that%20provides%20on-box%20enforcement%20of%20authorization.%20%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAthenz%E2%80%99s%20authorization%20system%20utilizes%20two%20types%20of%20tokens:%20principal%20tokens%20(N-Tokens)%20and%20role%20tokens%20(Z-Tokens).%20The%20principal%20token%20is%20an%20identity%20token%20that%20identifies%20either%20a%20user%20or%20a%20service.%20A%20service%20generates%20its%20principal%20token%20using%20that%20service%E2%80%99s%20private%20key.%20Role%20tokens%20authorize%20a%20given%20principal%20to%20assume%20some%20number%20of%20roles%20in%20a%20domain%20for%20a%20limited%20period%20of%20time.%20Like%20principal%20tokens,%20they%20are%20signed%20to%20prevent%20tampering.%20The%20name%20%E2%80%9CAthenz%E2%80%9D%20is%20derived%20from%20%E2%80%9CAuth%E2%80%9D%20and%20the%20%E2%80%98N%E2%80%99%20and%20&lsquo;Z%E2%80%99%20tokens.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ECentralized%20Access%20Control:%20%3C/b%3EThe%20centralized%20access%20control%20model%20requires%20any%20Athenz-enabled%20application%20to%20contact%20the%20Athenz%20Management%20Service%20directly%20to%20determine%20if%20a%20specific%20authenticated%20principal%20(user%20and/or%20service)%20has%20been%20authorized%20to%20carry%20out%20the%20given%20action%20on%20the%20requested%20resource.%20At%20Yahoo,%20our%20internal%20continuous%20delivery%20solution%20uses%20this%20model.%20A%20service%20receives%20a%20simple%20Boolean%20answer%20whether%20or%20not%20the%20request%20should%20be%20processed%20or%20rejected.%20In%20this%20model,%20the%20Athenz%20Management%20Service%20is%20the%20only%20component%20that%20needs%20to%20be%20deployed%20and%20managed%20within%20your%20environment.%20Therefore,%20it%20is%20suitable%20for%20provisioning%20and%20configuration%20use%20cases%20where%20the%20number%20of%20requests%20processed%20by%20the%20server%20is%20small%20and%20the%20latency%20for%20authorization%20checks%20is%20not%20important.%3Cbr/%3E%3Cbr/%3EThe%20diagram%20below%20shows%20a%20typical%20control%20plane-provisioning%20request%20handled%20by%20an%20Athenz-protected%20service.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221204%22%20data-orig-height=%22484%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/c87849251e3f4386a01b9974bb2f25bc/tumblr_inline_opp8h4iKQ71rma199_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221204%22%20data-orig-height=%22484%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Ccenter%3EAthenz%20Centralized%20Access%20Control%20Model%3C/center%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EDecentralized%20Access%20Control:%3C/b%3E%20This%20approach%20is%20ideal%20where%20the%20application%20is%20required%20to%20handle%20large%20number%20of%20requests%20per%20second%20and%20latency%20is%20a%20concern.%20It%E2%80%99s%20far%20more%20efficient%20to%20check%20authorization%20on%20the%20host%20itself%20and%20avoid%20the%20synchronous%20network%20call%20to%20a%20centralized%20Athenz%20Management%20Service.%20Athenz%20provides%20a%20way%20to%20do%20this%20with%20its%20decentralized%20service%20using%20a%20local%20policy%20engine%20library%20on%20the%20local%20box.%20At%20Yahoo,%20this%20is%20an%20approach%20we%20use%20for%20our%20centralized%20key%20management%20system.%20The%20authorization%20policies%20defining%20which%20roles%20have%20been%20authorized%20to%20carry%20out%20specific%20actions%20on%20resources,%20are%20asynchronously%20updated%20on%20application%20hosts%20and%20used%20by%20the%20Athenz%20local%20policy%20engine%20to%20evaluate%20the%20authorization%20check.%20In%20this%20model,%20a%20principal%20needs%20to%20contact%20the%20Athenz%20Token%20Service%20first%20to%20retrieve%20an%20authorization%20role%20token%20for%20the%20request%20and%20submit%20that%20token%20as%20part%20of%20its%20request%20to%20the%20Athenz%20protected%20service.%20The%20same%20role%20token%20can%20then%20be%20re-used%20for%20its%20lifetime.%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20diagram%20below%20shows%20a%20typical%20decentralized%20authorization%20request%20handled%20by%20an%20Athenz-protected%20service.%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221204%22%20data-orig-height=%22484%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/865956a4e93270f39204606f70491a9d/tumblr_inline_opp8hprVst1rma199_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221204%22%20data-orig-height=%22484%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Ccenter%3EAthenz%20Decentralized%20Access%20Control%20Model%3C/center%3E%3Cp%3EWith%20the%20power%20of%20an%20RBAC%20system%20in%20which%20you%20can%20choose%20a%20model%20to%20deploy%20according%20your%20performance%20latency%20needs,%20and%20the%20flexibility%20to%20choose%20either%20or%20both%20of%20the%20models%20in%20a%20complex%20environment%20of%20hosting%20platforms%20or%20products,%20it%20gives%20you%20the%20ability%20to%20run%20your%20business%20with%20agility%20and%20scale.%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ELooking%20to%20the%20Future%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20are%20actively%20engaged%20in%20pushing%20the%20scale%20and%20reliability%20boundaries%20of%20Athenz.%20As%20we%20enhance%20Athenz,%20we%20look%20forward%20to%20working%20with%20the%20community%20on%20the%20following%20features:%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3EUsing%20local%20CA%20signed%20TLS%20certificates%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EExtending%20Athenz%20with%20a%20generalized%20model%20for%20service%20providers%20to%20launch%20instances%20with%20bootstrapped%20Athenz%20service%20identity%20TLS%20certificates%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EIntegration%20with%20public%20cloud%20services%20like%20AWS.%20For%20example,%20launching%20an%20EC2%20instance%20with%20a%20configured%20Athenz%20service%20identity%20or%20obtaining%20AWS%20temporary%20credentials%20based%20on%20authorization%20policies%20defined%20in%20ZMS.%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp%3EOur%20goal%20is%20to%20integrate%20Athenz%20with%20other%20open%20source%20projects%20that%20require%20authorization%20support%20and%20we%20welcome%20contributions%20from%20the%20community%20to%20make%20that%20happen.%20It%20is%20available%20under%20Apache%20License%20Version%202.0.%20To%20evaluate%20Athenz,%20we%20provide%20both%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fyahoo%2Fathenz%2Fblob%2Fmaster%2Fdocs%2Fsetup_aws.md&amp;t=OWFlOTNmYjVkODE4ODFlN2VmMjZkYjExNzgxYzlkYTM5NWNkMWZhMixUckI3WlZpOA%3D%3D&amp;b=t%3AHaiI2WONanJV7htKsFJyFw&amp;p=https%3A%2F%2Fathenz-rbac.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F160482404029%2Fopen-sourcing-athenz-fine-grained-role-based&amp;m=1%22%3EAWS%20AMI%3C/a%3E%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fyahoo%2Fathenz%2Fblob%2Fmaster%2Fdocs%2Fsetup_docker.md&amp;t=MDYyOGJmYmViMGYxYjc0YzgwNjk5MTVlY2YwZWRjMDgyMjVhNDE5YixUckI3WlZpOA%3D%3D&amp;b=t%3AHaiI2WONanJV7htKsFJyFw&amp;p=https%3A%2F%2Fathenz-rbac.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F160482404029%2Fopen-sourcing-athenz-fine-grained-role-based&amp;m=1%22%3EDocker%3C/a%3E%20images%20so%20that%20you%20can%20quickly%20have%20a%20test%20development%20environment%20up%20and%20running%20with%20ZMS%20(Athenz%20Management%20Service),%20ZTS%20(Athenz%20Token%20Service),%20and%20UI%20services.%20Please%20join%20us%20on%20the%20path%20to%20making%20application%20authorization%20easy.%20Visit%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.athenz.io%2F&amp;t=ZWRkZjc0MDUyOTg1YWU5OWQxNTgzN2RkMjIyYTdhODk3Y2UyOTY4NSxUckI3WlZpOA%3D%3D&amp;b=t%3AHaiI2WONanJV7htKsFJyFw&amp;p=https%3A%2F%2Fathenz-rbac.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F160482404029%2Fopen-sourcing-athenz-fine-grained-role-based&amp;m=1%22%3Ehttp://www.athenz.io%3C/a%3E%20to%20get%20started!%3C/p%3E,https://athenz-rbac.tumblr.com/post/160486585974
mailto:?subject=Open%20Sourcing%20Bullet,%20Yahoo%E2%80%99s%20Forward-Looking%20Query%20Engine%20for%20Streaming%20Data&body=%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22561%22%20data-orig-height=%22150%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/2b369e81a844403d36fe56c6093ffe31/tumblr_inline_orli5vJTAD1rgj0aw_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22561%22%20data-orig-height=%22150%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EBy%20Michael%20Natkovich,%20Akshai%20Sarma,%20Nathan%20Speidel,%20Marcus%20Svedman,%20and%20Cat%20Utah%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EBig%20Data%20is%20no%20longer%20just%20Apache%20server%20logs.%20Nowadays,%20the%20data%20may%20be%20user%20engagement%20data,%20performance%20metrics,%20IoT%20(Internet%20of%20Things)%20data,%20or%20something%20else%20completely%20atypical.%20Regardless%20of%20the%20size%20of%20the%20data,%20or%20the%20type%20of%20querying%20patterns%20on%20it%20(exploratory,%20ad-hoc,%20periodic,%20long-term,%20etc.),%20everyone%20wants%20queries%20to%20be%20as%20fast%20as%20possible%20and%20cheap%20to%20run%20in%20terms%20of%20resources.%20Data%20can%20be%20broadly%20split%20into%20two%20kinds:%20the%20streaming%20(generally%20real-time)%20kind%20or%20the%20batched-up-over-a-time-interval%20(e.g.,%20hourly%20or%20daily)%20kind.%20The%20batch%20version%20is%20typically%20easier%20to%20query%20since%20it%20is%20stored%20somewhere%20like%20a%20data%20warehouse%20that%20has%20nice%20SQL-like%20interfaces%20or%20an%20easy%20to%20use%20UI%20provided%20by%20tools%20such%20as%20Tableau,%20Looker,%20or%20Superset.%20Running%20%3Ci%3Earbitrary%3C/i%3E%20queries%20on%20streaming%20data%20%3Ci%3Equickly%3C/i%3E%20and%20%3Ci%3Echeaply%3C/i%3E%20though,%20is%20generally%20much%20harder%E2%80%A6%20until%20now.%20Today,%20we%20are%20pleased%20to%20share%20our%20newly%20open%20sourced,%20%3Cb%3Eforward-looking%3C/b%3E%20general%20purpose%20query%20engine,%20called%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://bullet-db.github.io/%22%3EBullet%3C/a%3E,%20with%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://bullet-db.github.io/releases/%22%3Ecommunity%20on%20GitHub%3C/a%3E.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWith%20Bullet,%20you%20can:%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3EPowerful%20and%20nested%20filtering%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EFetching%20raw%20data%20records%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EAggregating%20data%20using%20Group%20Bys%20(Sum,%20Count,%20Average,%20etc.),%20Count%20Distincts,%20Top%20Ks%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EGetting%20distributions%20of%20fields%20like%20Percentiles%20or%20Frequency%20histograms%C2%A0%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp%3EOne%20of%20the%20key%20differences%20between%20how%20Bullet%20queries%20data%20and%20the%20standard%20querying%20paradigm%20is%20that%20Bullet%20does%20not%20store%20any%20data.%20In%20most%20other%20systems%20where%20you%20have%20a%20persistence%20layer%20(including%20in-memory%20storage),%20you%20are%20doing%20a%20look-back%20when%20you%20query%20the%20layer.%20Instead,%20Bullet%20operates%20on%20data%20flowing%20through%20the%20system%20after%20the%20query%20is%20started%20%E2%80%93%20it%E2%80%99s%20a%20look-forward%20system%20that%20doesn%E2%80%99t%20need%20persistence.%20On%20a%20real-time%20data%20stream,%20this%20means%20that%20%3Cb%3EBullet%20is%20querying%20data%20after%20the%20query%20is%20submitted%3C/b%3E.%20This%20also%20means%20that%20Bullet%20does%20not%20query%20any%20data%20that%20has%20already%20passed%20through%20the%20stream.%20The%20fact%20that%20Bullet%20does%20not%20rely%20on%20a%20persistence%20layer%20is%20exactly%20what%20makes%20it%20extremely%20lightweight%20and%20cheap%20to%20run.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETo%20see%20why%20this%20is%20better%20for%20the%20kinds%20of%20use%20cases%20Bullet%20is%20meant%20for%20%E2%80%93%20such%20as%20quickly%20looking%20at%20some%20metric,%20checking%20some%20assumption,%20iterating%20on%20a%20query,%20checking%20the%20status%20of%20something%20right%20now,%20etc.%20%E2%80%93%20consider%20the%20following:%20if%20you%20had%20a%201000%20queries%20in%20a%20traditional%20query%20system%20that%20operated%20on%20the%20same%20data,%20these%20query%20systems%20would%20most%20likely%20scan%20the%20data%201000%20times%20each.%20By%20the%20very%20virtue%20of%20it%20being%20forward%20looking,%201000%20queries%20in%20Bullet%20scan%20the%20data%20only%20once%20because%20the%20arrival%20of%20the%20query%20determines%20and%20fixes%20the%20data%20that%20it%20will%20see.%20Essentially,%20the%20data%20is%20coming%20to%20the%20queries%20instead%20of%20the%20queries%20being%20farmed%20out%20to%20where%20the%20data%20is.%20When%20the%20conditions%20of%20the%20query%20are%20satisfied%20(usually%20a%20time%20window%20or%20a%20number%20of%20events),%20the%20query%20terminates%20and%20returns%20you%20the%20result.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EA%20Brief%20Architecture%20Overview%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/BulletArchitecture.png%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221915%22%20data-orig-height=%22909%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/BulletArchitecture.png%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/ef8bf7871e2be25072f169a341bb7c37/tumblr_inline_pek5dn66tD1rgj0aw_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221915%22%20data-orig-height=%22909%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/BulletArchitecture.png%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EHigh%20Level%20Bullet%20Architecture%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20Bullet%20architecture%20is%20%3Ci%3Emulti-tenant%3C/i%3E,%20can%20%3Ci%3Escale%20linearly%3C/i%3E%20for%20more%20queries%20and/or%20more%20data,%20and%20has%20been%20tested%20to%20handle%20%3Ci%3E700+%3C/i%3E%20simultaneous%20queries%20on%20a%20data%20stream%20that%20had%20up%20to%20%3Ci%3E1.5%20million%3C/i%3E%20records%20per%20second,%20or%20%3Ci%3E5-6%20GB/s%3C/i%3E.%20Bullet%20is%20currently%20implemented%20on%20top%20of%20Storm%20and%20can%20be%20extended%20to%20support%20other%20stream%20processing%20engines%20as%20well,%20like%20Spark%20Streaming%20or%20Flink.%20Bullet%20is%20plug r%20(64%20Virtual%20Cores,%20256%20GB%20RAM%20each)%20test%20Storm%20cluster%20machines.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOne%20of%20the%20most%20popular%20use%20cases%20at%20Yahoo%20is%20to%20use%20Bullet%20to%20manually%20validate%20the%20instrumentation%20of%20an%20app%20or%20web%20application.%20Instrumentation%20produces%20user%20engagement%20data%20like%20clicks,%20views,%20swipes,%20etc.%20Since%20this%20data%20powers%20everything%20we%20do%20from%20analytics%20to%20personalization%20to%20targeting,%20it%20is%20absolutely%20critical%20that%20the%20data%20is%20correct.%20The%20usage%20pattern%20is%20generally%20to:%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Col%3E%3Cli%3ESubmit%20a%20Bullet%20query%20to%20obtain%20data%20associated%20with%20your%20mobile%20device%20or%20browser%20(filter%20on%20a%20cookie%20value%20or%20mobile%20device%20ID)%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EOpen%20and%20use%20the%20application%20to%20generate%20the%20data%20while%20the%20Bullet%20query%20is%20running%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EGo%20back%20to%20Bullet%20and%20inspect%20the%20data%C2%A0%3C/li%3E%3C/ol%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20addition,%20Bullet%20is%20also%20used%20programmatically%20in%20continuous%20delivery%20pipelines%20for%20functional%20testing%20instrumentation%20on%20product%20releases.%20Product%20usage%20is%20simulated,%20then%20data%20is%20generated%20and%20validated%20in%20seconds%20using%20Bullet.%20Bullet%20is%20orders%20of%20magnitude%20faster%20to%20use%20for%20this%20kind%20of%20validation%20and%20for%20general%20data%20exploration%20use%20cases,%20as%20opposed%20to%20waiting%20for%20the%20data%20to%20be%20available%20in%20Hive%20or%20other%20systems.%20The%20Bullet%20UI%20supports%20pivot%20tables%20and%20a%20multitude%20of%20charting%20options%20that%20may%20speed%20up%20analysis%20further%20compared%20to%20other%20querying%20options.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20also%20use%20Bullet%20to%20do%20a%20bunch%20of%20other%20interesting%20things,%20including%20instances%20where%20we%20dynamically%20compute%20cardinalities%20(using%20a%20Count%20Distinct%20Bullet%20query)%20of%20fields%20as%20a%20check%20to%20protect%20systems%20that%20can%E2%80%99t%20support%20extremely%20high%20cardinalities%20for%20fields%20like%20Druid.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWhat%20you%20do%20with%20Bullet%20is%20entirely%20determined%20by%20the%20data%20you%20put%20it%20on.%20If%20you%20put%20it%20on%20data%20that%20is%20essentially%20some%20set%20of%20performance%20metrics%20(data%20center%20statistics%20for%20example),%20you%20could%20be%20running%20a%20lot%20of%20queries%20that%20find%20the%2095th%20and%2099th%20percentile%20of%20a%20metric.%20If%20you%20put%20it%20on%20user%20engagement%20data,%20you%20could%20be%20validating%20instrumentation%20and%20mostly%20looking%20at%20raw%20data.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20hope%20you%20will%20find%20Bullet%20interesting%20and%20tell%20us%20how%20you%20use%20it.%20If%20you%20find%20something%20you%20want%20to%20change,%20improve,%20or%20fix,%20your%20contributions%20and%20ideas%20are%20always%20welcome!%20You%20can%20contact%20us%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://bullet-db.github.io/about/contact/%22%3Ehere%3C/a%3E.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EHelpful%20Links%3C/b%3E%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://bullet-db.github.io/quick-start/storm%22%3EQuick%20Start%3C/a%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://bullet-db.github.io/ui/usage/%22%3EUI%20Querying%20Demo%3C/a%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://bullet-db.github.io/%22%3EFull%20Documentation%3C/a%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/bullet-db%22%3EGitHub%20Links%3C/a%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://datasketches.github.io/%22%3EDataSketches%3C/a%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E,https://yahooeng.tumblr.com/post/161855616651
mailto:?subject=Open%20Sourcing%20Daytona:%20A%20Framework%20For%20Automated%20and%20Application-agnostic%20Performance%20Analysis&body=%3Cp%3EBy%20Sapan%20Panigrahi%20and%20Deepesh%20Mittal%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EToday,%20we%20are%20pleased%20to%20offer%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/daytona%22%3EDaytona%3C/a%3E,%20an%20open-source%20framework%20for%20automated%20performance%20testing%20and%20analysis,%20to%20the%20community.%20Daytona%20is%20an%20application-agnostic%20framework%20to%20conduct%20integrated%20performance%20testing%20and%20analysis%20with%20repeatable%20test%20execution,%20standardized%20reporting,%20and%20built-in%20profiling%20support.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EDaytona%20gives%20you%20the%20capability%20to%20build%20a%20customized%20test%20harness%20in%20a%20single,%20unified%20framework%20to%20test%20and%20analyze%20the%20performance%20of%20any%20application.%20You%E2%80%99ll%20get%20easy%20repeatability,%20consistent%20reporting,%20and%20the%20ability%20to%20capture%20trends.%20Daytona%E2%80%99s%20UI%20accepts%20a%20performance%20testing%20script%20that%20can%20run%20on%20a%20command%20line.%20This%20includes%20websites,%20databases,%20networks,%20or%20any%20workload%20you%20need%20to%20test%20and%20tune%20for%20performance.%20You%20can%20submit%20tests%20to%20the%20scheduler%20queue%20from%20the%20Daytona%20UI%20or%20from%20your%20CI/CD%20tool.%20You%20can%20deploy%20Daytona%20as%20a%20hosted%20service%20in%20your%20on-prem%20environment%20or%20on%20the%20public%20cloud%20of%20your%20choice.%20In%20fact,%20you%20can%20even%20host%20test%20harnesses%20for%20multiple%20applications%20with%20a%20single%20centralized%20service%20so%20that%20developers,%20architects,%20and%20systems%20engineers%20from%20different%20parts%20of%20your%20organization%20can%20work%20together%20on%20a%20unified%20view%20and%20manage%20your%20performance%20analysis%20on%20a%20continuous%20basis.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EDaytona%E2%80%99s%20differentiation%20lies%20in%20its%20ability%20to%20aggregate%20and%20present%20essential%20aspects%20of%20application,%20system,%20and%20hardware%20performance%20metrics%20with%20%3Cb%3Ea%20simple%20and%20unified%20user%20interface%3C/b%3E.%20This%20helps%20you%20maintain%20your%20focus%20on%20performance%20analysis%20without%20changing%20context%20across%20various%20sources%20and%20formats%20of%20data.%20The%20overall%20goal%20of%20performance%20analysis%20is%20to%20find%20ways%20of%20maximizing%20application%20throughput%20with%20minimum%20hardware%20resource%20and%20the%20best%20user%20experience.%20Metrics%20and%20insights%20from%20Daytona%20help%20achieve%20this%20objective.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EPrior%20to%20Daytona,%20we%20created%20multiple,%20heterogenous%20performance%20tools%20to%20meet%20the%20specific%20needs%20of%20various%20applications.%20This%20meant%20that%20we%20often%20stored%20test%20results%20inconsistently,%20making%20it%20harder%20to%20analyze%20performance%20in%20a%20comprehensive%20manner.%20We%20had%20a%20difficult%20time%20sharing%20results%20and%20analyzing%20differences%20in%20test%20runs%20in%20a%20standard%20manner,%20which%20could%20lead%20to%20confusion.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWith%20Daytona,%20we%20are%20now%20able%20to%20integrate%20all%20our%20load%20testing%20tools%20under%20a%20single%20framework%20and%20aggregate%20test%20results%20in%20one%20common%20central%20repository.%20We%20are%20gaining%20insight%20into%20the%20performance%20characteristics%20of%20many%20of%20our%20applications%20on%20a%20continuous%20basis.%20These%20insights%20help%20us%20optimize%20our%20applications%20which%20results%20in%20better%20utilization%20of%20our%20hardware%20resources%20and%20helps%20improve%20user%20experience%20by%20reducing%20the%20latency%20to%20serve%20end-user%20requests.%20Ultimately,%20Daytona%20helps%20us%20reduce%20capital%20expenditure%20on%20our%20large-scale%20infrastructure%20and%20makes%20our%20applications%20more%20robust%20under%20load.%20Sharing%20performance%20results%20in%20a%20common%20format%20encourages%20the%20use%20of%20common%20optimization%20techniques%20that%20we%20can%20leverage%20across%20many%20different%20applications.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EDaytona%20was%20built%20knowing%20that%20we%20would%20want%20to%20publish%20it%20as%20open%20source%20and%20share%20the%20technology%20with%20the%20community%20for%20validation%20and%20improvement%20of%20the%20framework.%20We%20hope%20the%20community%20can%20help%20extend%20its%20use%20cases%20and%20make%20it%20suitable%20for%20an%20even%20broader%20set%20of%20applications%20and%20workloads.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EArchitecture%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EDaytona%20is%20comprised%20of%20a%20centralized%20scheduler,%20a%20distributed%20set%20of%20agents%20running%20on%20SUTs%20(systems%20under%20test),%20a%20MySQL%20database%20to%20store%20all%20metadata%20for%20tests,%20and%20a%20PHP-based%20UI.%20A%20test%20harness%20can%20be%20customized%20by%20answering%20a%20simple%20set%20of%20questions%20about%20the%20application/workload.%20A%20test%20can%20be%20submitted%20to%20Daytona%E2%80%99s%20queue%20through%20the%20UI%20or%20through%20a%20CLI%20(Command%20Line%20Interface)%20from%20the%20CI/CD%20system.%20The%20scheduler%20process%20polls%20the%20database%20for%20a%20test%20to%20be%20run%20and%20sends%20all%20the%20actions%20associated%20with%20the%20execution%20of%20the%20test%20to%20the%20agent%20running%20on%20a%20SUT.%20An%20agent%20process%20executes%20the%20test,%20collects%20application%20and%20system%20performance%20metrics,%20and%20sends%20the%20metrics%20back%20as%20a%20package%20to%20the%20scheduler.%20The%20scheduler%20saves%20the%20test%20metadata%20in%20the%20database%20and%20test%20results%20in%20the%20local%20file%20system.%20Tests%20from%20multiple%20harnesses%20proceed%20concurrently.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/yahooeng/Daytona.png%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/yahooeng/Daytona.png%22%3E%3Cfigure%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%20data-orig-height=%22389%22%20data-orig-width=%22891%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/yahooeng/Daytona.png%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/a3e1a520bdd3dd74053b6514a5d6f622/tumblr_inline_pek5dnnWsr1rgj0aw_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-height=%22389%22%20data-orig-width=%22891%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/yahooeng/Daytona.png%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3C/a%3E%3Cp%3E%3C/p%3E%3Ccenter%3EArchitecture%20and%20Life%20Cycle%20Of%20A%20Test%3C/center%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ELooking%20Forward%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOur%20goal%20is%20to%20integrate%20Daytona%20with%20popular%20open%20source%20CI/CD%20tools%20and%20we%20welcome%20contributions%20from%20the%20community%20to%20make%20that%20happen.%20It%20is%20available%20under%20Apache%20License%20Version%202.0.%20To%20evaluate%20Daytona,%20we%20provide%20simple%20instructions%20to%20deploy%20it%20on%20your%20in-house%20bare%20metal,%20VM,%20or%20public%20cloud%20infrastructure.%20We%20also%20provide%20instructions%20so%20you%20can%20quickly%20have%20a%20test%20and%20development%20environment%20up%20and%20running%20on%20your%20laptop%20with%20Docker.%20Please%20join%20us%20on%20the%20path%20of%20making%20application%20performance%20analysis%20an%20enjoyable%20and%20insightful%20experience.%20Visit%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/daytona%22%3EDaytona%20Yahoo%20repo%3C/a%3E%20to%20get%20started!%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E,https://yahooeng.tumblr.com/post/160987779296

%20on%20existing%20big-data%20clusters,%20thus%20increasing%20the%20cost%20and%20latency%20for%20those%20who%20wanted%20to%20take%20advantage%20of%20this%20technology%20at%20scale.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETo%20address%20this%20limitation,%20several%20community%20projects%20wired%20TensorFlow%20onto%20Spark%20clusters.%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/amplab/SparkNet%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3ESparkNet%3C/a%3E%20added%20the%20ability%20to%20launch%20TensorFlow%20networks%20in%20Spark%20executors.%20DataBricks%20proposed%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/databricks/tensorframes%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3ETensorFrame%3C/a%3E%20to%20manipulate%20Apache%20Spark&rsquo;s%20DataFrames%20with%20TensorFlow%20programs.%20While%20these%20approaches%20are%20a%20step%20in%20the%20right%20direction,%20after%20examining%20their%20code,%20we%20learned%20we%20would%20be%20unable%20to%20get%20the%20TensorFlow%20processes%20to%20communicate%20with%20each%20other%20directly,%20we%20would%20not%20be%20able%20to%20implement%20asynchronous%20distributed%20learning,%20and%20we%20would%20have%20to%20expend%20significant%20effort%20to%20migrate%20existing%20TensorFlow%20programs.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ETensorFlowOnSpark%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure2.png%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure2.png%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure2.png%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure2.png%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3Cfigure%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%20data-orig-height=%22500%22%20data-orig-width=%22950%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure2.png%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/9bae4abc1c69491d645975b3f88137dc/tumblr_inline_p7g6lbEyCE1t17fny_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-height=%225 91231/TFoSFigure3.png%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure3.png%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3Cfigure%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%20data-orig-height=%22830%22%20data-orig-width=%221242%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure3.png%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/c7406e478beb085693c0e431f5f53c77/tumblr_inline_p7g6lbOEnO1t17fny_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-height=%22830%22%20data-orig-width=%221242%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure3.png%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3C/a%3E%3Cp%3ETensorFlowOnSpark%20provides%20two%20different%20modes%20to%20ingest%20data%20for%20training%20and%20inference:%3C/p%3E%3Col%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cb%3ETensorFlow%20QueueRunners%3C/b%3E:%20TensorFlowOnSpark%20leverages%20TensorFlow&rsquo;s%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.tensorflow.org/how_tos/reading_data/#reading_from_files%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Efile%20readers%3C/a%3E%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.tensorflow.org/how_tos/threading_and_queues/#queuerunner%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3EQueueRunners%3C/a%3E%20to%20read%20data%20directly%20from%20HDFS%20files.%20Spark%20is%20not%20involved%20in%20accessing%20data.%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Cb%3ESpark%20Feeding%3C/b%3E:%20Spark%20RDD%20data%20is%20fed%20to%20each%20Spark%20executor,%20which%20subsequently%20feeds%20the%20data%20into%20the%20TensorFlow%20graph%20via%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.tensorflow.org/how_tos/reading_data/#feeding%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Efeed_dict%3C/a%3E.%3C/li%3E%3C/ol%3E%3Cp%3EFigure%204%20illustrates%20how%20the%20synchronous%20distributed%20training%20of%3Ca%20href=%22http://googleresearch.blogspot.com/2016/03/train-your-own-image-classifier-with.html%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%20Inception%20image%20classification%3C/a%3E%20network%20scales%20in%20TFoS%20using%20QueueRunners%20with%20a%20simple%20setting:%201%20GPU,%201%20reader,%20and%20batch%20size%2032%20for%20each%20worker.%20Four%20TFoS%20jobs%20were%20launched%20to%20train%20100,000%20steps.%20When%20these%20jobs%20completed%20after%202+%20days,%20the%20top-5%20accuracy%20of%20these%20jobs%20were%200.730,%200.814,%200.854,%20and%200.879.%20Reaching%20top-5%20accuracy%20of%200.730%20takes%2046%20hours%20for%20a%201-worker%20job,%2022.5%20hours%20for%20a%202-worker%20job,%2013%20hours%20for%20a%204-worker%20job,%20and%207.5%20hours%20for%20an%208-worker%20job.%20TFoS%20thus%20achieves%20near%20linear%20scalability%20for%20Inception%20model%20training.%20This%20is%20very%20encouraging,%20although%20TFoS%20scalability%20will%20vary%20for%20different%20models%20and%20hyperparameters.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure4.png%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure4.png%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure4.png%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure4.png%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3Cfigure%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%20data-orig-height=%22934%22%20data-orig-width=%221076%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure4.png%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/bcf6bf5c80a23598f71c59807d461d5a/tumblr_inline_p7g6lcYgPQ1t17fny_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-height=%22934%22%20data-orig-width=%221076%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://s.yimg.com/ge/default/691231/TFoSFigure4.png%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3C/a%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ERDMA%20for%20Distributed%20TensorFlow%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20Yahoo%E2%80%99s%20Hadoop%20clusters,%20GPU%20nodes%20are%20connected%20by%20both%20Ethernet%20and%20Infiniband.%20Infiniband%20provides%20faster%20connectivity%20and%20supports%20direct%20access%20to%20other%20servers%E2%80%99%20memories%20over%20RDMA.%20Current%20TensorFlow%20releases,%20however,%20only%20support%20distributed%20learning%20using%20gRPC%20over%20Ethernet.%20To%20speed%20up%20distributed%20learning,%20we%20have%20enhanced%20the%20TensorFlow%20C++%20layer%20to%20enable%20RDMA%20over%20Infiniband.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20conjunction%20with%20our%20TFoS%20release,%20we%20are%20introducing%20a%20new%20protocol%20for%20TensorFlow%20servers%20in%20addition%20to%20the%20default%20%3Ci%3E%E2%80%9Cgrpc%E2%80%9D%3C/i%3E%20protocol.%20Any%20distributed%20TensorFlow%20program%20can%20leverage%20our%20enhancement%20via%20specifying%20%3Ci%3Eprotocol=%E2%80%9Cgrpc_rdma%E2%80%9D%3C/i%3E%20in%20%3Ci%3Etf.train.ServerDef()%3C/i%3E%20or%20%3Ci%3Etf.train.Server()%3C/i%3E.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWith%20this%20new%20protocol,%20a%20RDMA%20rendezvous%20manager%20is%20created%20to%20ensure%20tensors%20are%20written%20directly%20into%20the%20memory%20of%20remote%20servers.%20We%20minimize%20the%20tensor%20buffer%20creation:%20Tensor%20buffers%20are%20allocated%20once%20at%20the%20beginning,%20and%20then%20reused%20across%20all%20training%20steps%20of%20a%20TensorFlow%20job.%20From%20our%20early%20experimentation%20with%20large%20models%20like%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://www.robots.ox.ac.uk/~vgg/research/very_deep/%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3EVGG-19%20network%3C/a%3E,%20our%20RDMA%20implementation%20has%20demonstrated%20a%20significant%20speedup%20on%20training%20time%20compared%20with%20the%20existing%20gRPC%20implementation.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESince%20RDMA%20support%20is%20a%20highly%20requested%20capability%20(see%20TensorFlow%20issue%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/2916%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E#2916%3C/a%3E),%20we%20decided%20to%20make%20our%20current%20implementation%20available%20as%20an%20alpha%20release%20to%20the%20TensorFlow%20community.%20In%20the%20coming%20weeks,%20we%20will%20polish%20our%20RDMA%20implementation%20further,%20and%20share%20detailed%20benchmark%20results.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ESimple%20CLI%20and%20API%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETFoS%20programs%20are%20launched%20by%20the%20standard%20Apache%20Spark%20command,%20%3Ci%3Espark-submit%3C/i%3E.%20As%20illustrated%20below,%20users%20can%20specify%20the%20number%20of%20Spark%20executors,%20the%20number%20of%20GPUs%20per%20executor,%20and%20the%20number%20of%20parameter%20servers%20in%20the%20CLI.%20A%20user%20can%20also%20state%20whether%20they%20want%20to%20use%20TensorBoard%20(&ndash;tensorboard)%20and/or%20RDMA%20(&ndash;rdma).%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%20spark-submit%20&ndash;master%20${MASTER}%20\%20%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%20${TFoS_HOME}/examples/slim/train_image_classifier.py%20\%20%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%C2%A0%20&ndash;model_name%20inception_v3%20\%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20&ndash;train_dir%20hdfs://default/slim_train%20\%20%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20&ndash;dataset_dir%20hdfs://default/data/imagenet%20\%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20&ndash;dataset_name%20imagenet%20\%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20&ndash;dataset_split_name%20train%20\%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20&ndash;cluster_size%20${NUM_EXEC}%20\%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20&ndash;num_gpus%20${NUM_GPU}%20\%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%C2%A0%20&ndash;num_ps_tasks%20${NUM_PS}%20\%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%C2%A0%20&ndash;sync_replicas%20\%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%C2%A0%20&ndash;replicas_to_aggregate%20${NUM_WORKERS}%20\%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%C2%A0%20&ndash;tensorboard%20\%3Cbr/%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%C2%A0%20&ndash;rdma%20%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETFoS%20provides%20a%20high-level%20Python%20API%20(illustrated%20in%20our%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/TensorFlowOnSpark/blob/master/examples/mnist/TFOS_demo.ipynb%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Esample%20Python%20notebook%3C/a%3E):%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3ETFCluster.reserve()%20%E2%80%A6%20construct%20a%20TensorFlow%20cluster%20from%20Spark%20executors%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3ETFCluster.start()%20%E2%80%A6%20launch%20Tensorflow%20program%20on%20the%20executors%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3ETFCluster.train()%20or%20TFCluster.inference()%20%E2%80%A6%20feed%20RDD%20data%20to%20TensorFlow%20processes%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3ETFCluster.shutdown()%20%E2%80%A6%20shutdown%20Tensorflow%20execution%20on%20executors%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EOpen%20Source%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EYahoo%20is%20happy%20to%20release%20TensorFlowOnSpark%20at%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/TensorFlowOnSpark%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Egithub.com/yahoo/TensorFlowOnSpark%3C/a%3E%20and%20a%20RDMA%20enhancement%20of%20TensorFlow%20at%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/tensorflow/tree/yahoo%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Egithub.com/yahoo/tensorflow/tree/yahoo%3C/a%3E.%20Multiple%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/TensorFlowOnSpark/tree/master/examples%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Eexample%20programs%3C/a%3E%20(including%20mnist,%20cifar10,%20inception,%20and%20VGG)%20are%20provided%20to%20illustrate%20the%20simple%20conversion%20process%20of%20TensorFlow%20programs%20to%20TensorFlowOnSpark,%20and%20leverage%20RDMA.%20An%20Amazon%20Machine%20Image%20is%20also%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/TensorFlowOnSpark/wiki/GetStarted_EC2%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Eavailable%3C/a%3E%20for%20applying%20TensorFlowOnSpark%20on%20AWS%20EC2.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EGoing%20forward,%20we%20will%20advance%20TensorFlowOnSpark%20as%20we%20continue%20to%20do%20with%20CaffeOnSpark.%20We%20welcome%20the%20community%E2%80%99s%20continued%20feedback%20and%20contributions%20to%20CaffeOnSpark,%20and%20are%20interested%20in%20thoughts%20on%20ways%20TensorFlowOnSpark%20can%20be%20enhanced.%3C/p%3E,http://yahoohadoop.tumblr.com/post/157196317141
mailto:?subject=Open-Sourcing%20Panoptes,%20Oath%E2%80%99s%20distributed%20network%20telemetry%20collector&body=%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://yahoodevelopers.tumblr.com/post/178699833943/open-sourcing-panoptes-oaths-distributed-network%22%20class=%22tumblr_blog%22%3Eyahoodevelopers%3C/a%3E:%3C/p%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3Cp%3EBy%20Ian%20Flint,%20Network%20Automation%20Architect%20and%20Varun%20Varma,%20Senior%20Principal%20Engineer%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20Oath%20network%20automation%20team%20is%20proud%20to%20announce%20that%20we%20are%20open-sourcing%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/panoptes%22%3EPanoptes%3C/a%3E,%20a%20distributed%20system%20for%20collecting,%20enriching%20and%20distributing%20network%20telemetry.%20%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20developed%20Panoptes%20to%20address%20several%20issues%20inherent%20in%20legacy%20polling%20systems,%20including%20overpolling%20due%20to%20multiple%20point%20solutions%20for%20metrics,%20a%20lack%20of%20data%20normalization,%20consistent%20data%20enrichment%20and%20integration%20with%20infrastructure%20discovery%20systems.%20%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EPanoptes%20is%20a%20pluggable,%20distributed,%20high-performance%20data%20collection%20system%20which%20supports%20multiple%20polling%20formats,%20including%20SNMP%20and%20vendor-specific%20APIs.%20It%20is%20also%20extensible%20to%20support%20emerging%20streaming%20telemetry%20standards%20including%20gNMI.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EArchitecture%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20following%20block%20diagram%20shows%20the%20major%20components%20of%20Panoptes:%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%20data-orig-height=%22720%22%20data-orig-width=%22960%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/1d91c0bf305fc8986648ef529be1c7d6/tumblr_inline_pg14wwqH9X1w911gs_540.png%22%20data-orig-height=%22720%22%20data-orig-width=%22960%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EPanoptes%20is%20written%20primarily%20in%20Python,%20and%20leverages%20multiple%20open-source%20technologies%20to%20provide%20the%20most%20value%20for%20the%20least%20development%20effort.%20At%20the%20center%20of%20Panoptes%20is%20a%20metrics%20bus%20implemented%20on%20Kafka.%20All%20data%20plane%20transactions%20flow%20across%20this%20bus;%20discovery%20publishes%20devices%20to%20the%20bus,%20polling%20publishes%20metrics%20to%20the%20bus,%20and%20numerous%20clients%20read%20the%20data%20off%20of%20the%20bus%20for%20additional%20processing%20and%20forwarding.%20This%20architecture%20enables%20easy%20data%20distribution%20and%20integration%20with%20other%20systems.%20For%20example,%20in%20preparing%20for%20open-source,%20we%20identified%20a%20need%20for%20a%20generally%20available%20time%20series%20datastore.%20We%20developed,%20tested%20and%20released%20a%20plugin%20to%20push%20metrics%20into%20InfluxDB%20in%20under%20a%20week.%20This%20flexibility%20allows%20Panoptes%20to%20evolve%20with%20industry%20standards.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ECheck%20scheduling%20is%20accomplished%20using%20Celery,%20a%20horizontally%20scalable,%20open-source%20scheduler%20utilizing%20a%20Redis%20data%20store.%20Celery%E2%80%99s%20scalable%20nature%20combined%20with%20Panoptes%E2%80%99%20distributed%20nature%20yields%20excellent%20scalability.%20Across%20Oath,%20Panoptes%20currently%20runs%20hundreds%20of%20thousands%20of%20checks%20per%20second,%20and%20the%20infrastructure%20has%20been%20tested%20to%20more%20than%20one%20million%20checks%20per%20second.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EPanoptes%20ships%20with%20a%20simple,%20CSV-based%20discovery%20system.%20Integrating%20Panoptes%20with%20a%20CMDB%20is%20as%20simple%20as%20writing%20an%20adapter%20to%20emit%20a%20CSV,%20and%20importing%20that%20CSV%20into%20Panoptes.%20From%20there,%20Panoptes%20will%20manage%20the%20task%20of%20scheduling%20polling%20for%20the%20desired%20devices.%20Users%20can%20also%20develop%20custom%20discovery%20plugins%20to%20integrate%20with%20their%20CMDB%20and%20other%20device%20inventory%20data%20sources.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EFinally,%20any%20metrics%20gathering%20system%20needs%20a%20place%20to%20send%20the%20metrics.%20Panoptes%E2%80%99%20initial%20release%20includes%20an%20integration%20with%20InfluxDB,%20an%20industry-standard%20time%20series%20store.%20Combined%20with%20Grafana%20and%20the%20InfluxData%20ecosystem,%20this%20gives%20teams%20the%20ability%20to%20quickly%20set%20up%20a%20fully-featured%20monitoring%20environment.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EDeployment%20at%20Oath%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAt%20Oath,%20we%20anticipate%20significant%20benefits%20from%20building%20Panoptes.%20We%20will%20consolidate%20four%20siloed%20polling%20solutions%20into%20one,%20reducing%20overpolling%20and%20the%20associated%20risk%20of%20service%20interruption.%20As%20vendors%20move%20toward%20streaming%20telemetry,%20Panoptes%E2%80%99%20flexible%20architecture%20will%20minimize%20the%20effort%20required%20to%20adopt%20these%20new%20protocols.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThere%20is%20another,%20less%20obvious%20benefit%20to%20a%20system%20like%20Panoptes.%20As%20is%20the%20case%20with%20most%20large%20enterprises,%20a%20massive%20ecosystem%20of%20downstream%20applications%20has%20evolved%20around%20our%20existing%20polling%20solutions.%20Panoptes%20allows%20us%20to%20continue%20to%20populate%20legacy%20datastores%20without%20continuing%20to%20run%20the%20polling%20layers%20of%20those%20systems.%20This%20is%20because%20Panoptes%E2%80%99%20data%20bus%20enables%20multiple%20metrics%20consumers,%20so%20we%20can%20send%20metrics%20to%20both%20current%20and%20legacy%20datastores.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAt%20Oath,%20we%20have%20deployed%20Panoptes%20in%20a%20tiered,%20federated%20model.%20We%20install%20the%20software%20in%20each%20of%20our%20major%20data%20centers%20and%20proxy%20checks%20out%20to%20smaller%20installations%20such%20as%20edge%20sites.%20%C2%A0All%20metrics%20are%20polled%20from%20an%20instance%20close%20to%20the%20devices,%20and%20metrics%20are%20forwarded%20to%20a%20centralized%20time%20series%20datastore.%20We%20have%20also%20developed%20numerous%20custom%20applications%20on%20the%20platform,%20including%20a%20load%20balancer%20monitor,%20a%20BGP%20session%20monitor,%20and%20a%20topology%20discovery%20application.%20The%20availability%20of%20a%20flexible,%20extensible%20platform%20has%20greatly%20reduced%20the%20cost%20of%20producing%20robust%20network%20data%20systems.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EEasy%20Setup%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EPanoptes%E2%80%99%20open-source%20release%20is%20packaged%20for%20easy%20deployment%20into%20any%20Linux-based%20environment.%20Deployment%20is%20straightforward,%20so%20you%20can%20have%20a%20working%20system%20up%20in%20hours,%20not%20days.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20are%20excited%20to%20share%20our%20internal%20polling%20solution%20and%20welcome%20engineers%20to%20contribute%20to%20the%20codebase,%20including%20contributing%20device%20adapters,%20metrics%20forwarders,%20discovery%20plugins,%20and%20any%20other%20relevant%20data%20consumers.%20%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ci%3EPanoptes%20is%20available%20at%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/panoptes%22%3Ehttps://github.com/yahoo/panoptes%3C/a%3E,%20and%20you%20can%20connect%20with%20our%20team%20at%20%3Ca%20href=%22mailto:network-automation@oath.com%22%3Enetwork-automation@oath.com%3C/a%3E.%3C/i%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3C/blockquote%3E,https://yahooeng.tumblr.com/post/178738044351

mailto:?subject=Panoptes,%20an%20open%20source%20distributed%20network%20telemetry%20ecosystem%20is%20now%20available%20on%20Docker&body=%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/jamesdiss/%22%3EJames%20Diss%3C/a%3E,%20Software%20Systems%20Engineer,%20Verizon%20Media%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EPanoptes%20is%20an%20open%20source%20network%20telemetry%20system%20that%20we%20built%20to%20replace%20a%20myriad%20of%20tools%20and%20scripts%20built%20up%20over%20time%20to%20monitor%20the%20fleet%20of%20hosts%20worldwide.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20core%20framework%20is%20designed%20to%20be%20extended%20through%20the%20use%20of%20plugins%20which%20allows%20the%20many%20different%20devices%20and%20device%20types%20to%20be%20monitored.%20%20Within%20Verizon%20Media,%20Panoptes%20provides%20the%20data%20collection%20layer%20that%20we%20feed%20to%20other%20projects%20to%20allow%20for%20visualization%20of%20device%20health%20according%20to%20need,%20alerting%20and%20collation%20of%20information.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ENormally%20the%20components%20of%20Panoptes%20run%20as%20a%20distributed%20system%20that%20allows%20for%20horizontal%20scaling%20and%20sharding%20to%20different%20geographical%20and%20virtual%20locations,%20handling%20thousands%20of%20endpoints,%20but%20this%20can%20be%20a%20difficult%20environment%20to%20simulate.%20Therefore,%20we%20have%20created%20a%20docker%20image%20which%20holds%20the%20entire%20structure%20of%20Panoptes%20in%20a%20single%20container.%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/59917791544478538356563b5e7a7aa4/tumblr_inline_pp393jrcQR1wxhpzr_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EI%20hasten%20to%20add%20that%20this%20is%20not%20a%20production%20instance%20of%20Panoptes,%20and%20we%20would%20not%20recommend%20trying%20to%20use%20the%20docker%20container%20%E2%80%9Cas-is%E2%80%9D.%20Rather,%20it%20is%20more%20of%20a%20workbench%20installation%20to%20examine%20in%20motion.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20container%20is%20entirely%20self-contained%20and%20builds%20Panopt formance%20comparison%20between%20Vespa%20and%20TensorFlow%20for%20cases%20that%20use%20a%20machine%20learning%20ranking%20model.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EBefore%20we%20get%20to%20that%20however,%20it%20is%20worth%20noting%20that%20Vespa%20and%20TensorFlow%20serving%20has%20an%20important%20conceptual%20difference.%20With%20TensorFlow%20you%20are%20typically%20interested%20in%20evaluating%20a%20model%20for%20a%20%3Ci%3Esingle%3C/i%3E%20data%20point,%20be%20that%20an%20image%20for%20an%20image%20classifier,%20or%20a%20sentence%20for%20a%20semantic%20representation%20etc.%20The%20use%20case%20for%20Vespa%20is%20when%20you%20need%20to%20evaluate%20the%20model%20over%20%3Ci%3Emany%3C/i%3E%20data%20points.%20Examples%20are%20finding%20the%20best%20document%20given%20a%20text,%20or%20images%20similar%20to%20a%20given%20image,%20or%20computing%20a%20stream%20of%20recommendations%20for%20a%20user.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESo,%20let%E2%80%99s%20explore%20this%20by%20setting%20up%20a%20typical%20search%20application%20in%20Vespa.%20We%E2%80%99ve%20based%20the%20application%20in%20this%20post%20on%20the%20Vespa%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/tutorials/blog-recommendation-nn.html%22%3Eblog%20recommendation%20tutorial%20part%203%3C/a%3E.%20In%20this%20application%20we&rsquo;ve%20trained%20a%20collaborative%20filtering%20model%20which%20computes%20an%20%3Ci%3Einterest%20vector%3C/i%3E%20for%20each%20existing%20user%20(which%20we%20refer%20to%20as%20the%20user%20profile)%20and%20a%20%3Ci%3Econtent%20vector%3C/i%3E%20for%20each%20blog%20post.%20In%20collaborative%20filtering%20these%20vectors%20are%20commonly%20referred%20to%20as%20%3Ci%3Elatent%20factors%3C/i%3E.%20The%20application%20takes%20a%20user%20id%20as%20the%20query,%20retrieves%20the%20corresponding%20user%20profile,%20and%20searches%20for%20the%20blog%20posts%20that%20best%20match%20the%20user%20profile.%20The%20match%20is%20computed%20by%20a%20simple%20dot-product%20between%20the%20latent%20factor%20vectors.%20This%20is%20used%20as%20the%20first%20phase%20ranking.%20We&rsquo;ve%20chosen%20vectors%20of%20length%20128.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20addition,%20we&rsquo;ve%20trained%20a%20neural%20network%20in%20TensorFlow%20to%20serve%20as%20the%20second-phase%20ranking.%20The%20user%20vector%20and%20blog%20post%20vector%20are%20concatenated%20and%20represents%20the%20input%20(of%20size%20256)%20to%20the%20neural%20network.%20The%20network%20is%20fully%20connected%20with%202%20hidden%20layers%20of%20size%20512%20and%20128%20respectively,%20and%20the%20network%20has%20a%20single%20output%20value%20representing%20the%20probability%20that%20the%20user%20would%20like%20the%20blog%20post.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20the%20following%20we%20set%20up%20two%20cases%20we%20would%20like%20to%20compare.%20The%20first%20is%20where%20the%20imported%20neural%20network%20is%20evaluated%20on%20the%20content%20node%20using%20Vespa&rsquo;s%20native%20tensors.%20In%20the%20other%20we%20run%20TensorFlow%20directly%20on%20the%20stateless%20%3Ci%3Econtainer%3C/i%3E%20node%20in%20the%20Vespa%202-tier%20architecture.%20In%20this%20case,%20the%20additional%20data%20required%20to%20evaluate%20the%20TensorFlow%20model%20must%20be%20passed%20back%20from%20the%20%3Ci%3Econtent%3C/i%3E%20node(s)%20to%20the%20container%20node.%20We%20use%20Vespa&rsquo;s%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/vespa-engine/vespa/tree/master/fbench%22%3Efbench%20utility%3C/a%3E%20to%20stress%20the%20system%20under%20fairly%20heavy%20load.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20this%20first%20test,%20we%20set%20up%20the%20system%20on%20a%20single%20host.%20This%20means%20the%20container%20and%20content%20nodes%20are%20running%20on%20the%20same%20host.%20We%20set%20up%20%3Ci%3Efbench%3C/i%3E%20so%20it%20uses%2064%20clients%20in%20parallel%20to%20query%20this%20system%20as%20fast%20as%20possible.%201000%20documents%20per%20query%20are%20evaluated%20in%20the%20first%20phase%20and%20the%20top%20200%20documents%20are%20evaluated%20in%20the%20second%20phase.%20In%20the%20following,%20latency%20is%20measured%20in%20ms%20at%20the%2095th%20percentile%20and%20QPS%20is%20the%20actual%20query%20rate%20in%20queries%20per%20second:%3C/p%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3C/blockquote%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3EBaseline:%2019.68%20ms%20/%203251.80%20QPS%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EBaseline%20with%20additional%20data:%2024.20%20ms%20/%202644.74%20QPS%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EVespa%20ranking:%2042.8%20ms%20/%201495.02%20QPS%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3ETensorFlow%20batch%20ranking:%2042.67%20ms%20/%201499.80%20QPS%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3ETensorFlow%20single%20ranking:%20103.23%20ms%20/%20619.97%20QPS%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp%3ESome%20explanation%20is%20in%20order.%20The%20%3Ci%3Ebaseline%3C/i%3E%20here%20is%20the%20first%20phase%20ranking%20only%20without%20returning%20the%20additional%20data%20required%20for%20full%20ranking.%20The%3Ci%3E%20baseline%20with%20additional%20data%20%3C/i%3Eis%20the%20same%20but%20returns%20the%20data%20required%20for%20ranking.%20%3Ci%3EVespa%20ranking%3C/i%3E%20evaluates%20the%20model%20on%20the%20content%20backend.%20Both%20%3Ci%3ETensorFlow%3C/i%3E%20tests%20evaluate%20the%20model%20after%20content%20has%20been%20sent%20to%20the%20container.%20The%20difference%20is%20that%20%3Ci%3Ebatch%3C/i%3E%20ranking%20evaluates%20the%20model%20in%20one%20pass%20by%20batching%20the%20200%20documents%20together%20in%20a%20larger%20matrix,%20while%20%3Ci%3Esingle%3C/i%3E%20evaluates%20the%20model%20once%20per%20document,%20i.e.%20200%20evaluations.%20The%20reason%20why%20we%20test%20this%20is%20that%20Vespa%20evaluates%20the%20model%20once%20per%20document%20to%20be%20able%20to%20evaluate%20during%20matching,%20so%20in%20terms%20of%20efficiency%20this%20is%20a%20fairer%20comparison.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20see%20in%20the%20numbers%20above%20for%20this%20application%20that%20%3Ci%3EVespa%20ranking%3C/i%3E%20and%20%3Ci%3ETensorFlow%20batch%20ranking%3C/i%3E%20achieve%20similar%20performance.%20This%20means%20that%20the%20gains%20in%20ranking%20batch-wise%20is%20offset%20by%20the%20cost%20of%20transferring%20data%20to%20TensorFlow.%20This%20isn%E2%80%99t%20entirely%20a%20fair%20comparison%20however,%20as%20the%20model%20evaluation%20architecture%20of%20Vespa%20and%20TensorFlow%20differ%20significantly.%20For%20instance,%20we%20measure%20that%20TensorFlow%20has%20a%20much%20lower%20degree%20of%20cache%20misses.%20One%20reason%20is%20that%20batch-ranking%20necessitates%20a%20more%20contiguous%20data%20layout.%20In%20contrast,%20relevant%20document%20data%20can%20be%20spread%20out%20over%20the%20entire%20available%20memory%20on%20the%20Vespa%20content%20nodes.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAnother%20significant%20reason%20is%20that%20Vespa%20currently%20uses%20double%20floating%20point%20precision%20in%20ranking%20and%20in%20tensors.%20In%20the%20above%20TensorFlow%20model%20we%20have%20used%20floats,%20resulting%20in%20half%20the%20required%20memory%20bandwidth.%20We%20are%20considering%20making%20the%20floating%20point%20precision%20in%20Vespa%20configurable%20to%20improve%20evaluation%20speed%20for%20cases%20where%20full%20precision%20is%20not%20necessary,%20such%20as%20in%20most%20machine%20learned%20models.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESo%20we%20still%20have%20some%20work%20to%20do%20in%20optimizing%20our%20tensor%20evaluation%20pipeline,%20but%20we%20are%20pleased%20with%20our%20results%20so%20far.%20Now,%20the%20performance%20of%20the%20model%20evaluation%20itself%20is%20only%20a%20part%20of%20the%20system-wide%20performance.%20In%20order%20to%20rank%20with%20TensorFlow,%20we%20need%20to%20move%20data%20to%20the%20host%20running%20TensorFlow.%20This%20is%20not%20free,%20so%20let%E2%80%99s%20delve%20a%20bit%20deeper%20into%20this%20cost.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20locality%20of%20data%20in%20relation%20to%20where%20the%20ranking%20computation%20takes%20place%20is%20an%20important%20aspect%20and%20indeed%20a%20core%20design%20point%20of%20Vespa.%20If%20your%20data%20is%20too%20large%20to%20fit%20on%20a%20single%20machine,%20or%20you%20want%20to%20evaluate%20your%20model%20on%20more%20data%20points%20faster%20than%20is%20possible%20on%20a%20single%20machine,%20you%20need%20to%20split%20your%20data%20over%20multiple%20nodes.%20Let%E2%80%99s%20assume%20that%20documents%20are%20distributed%20randomly%20across%20all%20content%20nodes,%20which%20is%20a%20very%20reasonable%20thing%20to%20do.%20Now,%20when%20you%20need%20to%20find%20the%20globally%20top-N%20documents%20for%20a%20given%20query,%20you%20first%20need%20to%20find%20the%20set%20of%20candidate%20documents%20that%20match%20the%20query.%20In%20general,%20if%20ranking%20is%20done%20on%20some%20other%20node%20than%20where%20the%20content%20is,%20all%20the%20data%20required%20for%20the%20computation%20obviously%20needs%20to%20be%20transferred%20there.%20Usually,%20the%20candidate%20set%20can%20be%20large%20so%20this%20incurs%20a%20significant%20cost%20in%20network%20activity,%20particularly%20as%20the%20number%20of%20content%20nodes%20increase.%20This%20approach%20can%20become%20infeasible%20quite%20quickly.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThis%20is%20why%20a%20core%20design%20aspect%20of%20Vespa%20is%20to%20evaluate%20models%20where%20the%20content%20is%20stored.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221058%22%20data-orig-height=%22330%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/3cd72a28574d1083afc055d6f9b73243/tumblr_inline_p8cvpmLZHf1vpfrlb_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221058%22%20data-orig-height=%22330%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EThis%20is%20illustrated%20in%20the%20figure%20above.%20The%20problem%20of%20transferring%20data%20for%20ranking%20is%20compounded%20as%20the%20number%20of%20content%20nodes%20increase,%20because%20to%20find%20the%20global%20top-N%20documents,%20the%20top-K%20documents%20of%20each%20content%20node%20need%20to%20be%20passed%20to%20the%20external%20ranker.%20This%20means%20that,%20if%20we%20have%20C%20content%20nodes,%20we%20need%20to%20transfer%20C*K%20documents%20over%20the%20network.%20This%20runs%20into%20hard%20network%20limits%20as%20the%20number%20of%20documents%20and%20data%20size%20for%20each%20document%20increases.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ELet%E2%80%99s%20see%20the%20effect%20of%20this%20when%20we%20change%20the%20setup%20of%20the%20same%20application%20to%20run%20on%20three%20content%20nodes%20and%20a%20single%20stateless%20container%20which%20runs%20TensorFlow.%20In%20the%20following%20graph%20we%20plot%20the%2095th%20percentile%20latency%20as%20we%20increase%20the%20number%20of%20parallel%20requests%20(clients)%20from%201%20to%2030:%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22586%22%20data-orig-height=%22351%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/da3ec19754643b607f13a62bc958607f/tumblr_inline_p8cvr74YpB1vpfrlb_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22586%22%20data-orig-height=%22351%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EHere%20we%20see%20that%20with%20low%20traffic,%20TensorFlow%20and%20Vespa%20are%20comparable%20in%20terms%20of%20latency.%20When%20we%20increase%20the%20load%20however,%20the%20cost%20of%20transmitting%20the%20data%20is%20the%20driver%20for%20the%20increase%20in%20latency%20for%20TensorFlow,%20as%20seen%20in%20the%20red%20line%20in%20the%20graph.%20The%20differences%20between%20batch%20and%20single%20mode%20TensorFlow%20evaluation%20become%20smaller%20as%20the%20system%20as%20a%20whole%20becomes%20largely%20network-bound.%20In%20contrast,%20the%20Vespa%20application%20scales%20much%20better.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ENow,%20as%20we%20increase%20traffic%20even%20further,%20will%20the%20Vespa%20solution%20likewise%20become%20network-bound?%20In%20the%20following%20graph%20we%20plot%20the%20sustained%20requests%20per%20second%20as%20we%20increase%20clients%20to%20200:%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22578%22%20data-orig-height=%22359%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/2d26bc6aec057d14216f21c00104e9d9/tumblr_inline_p8cvru8fzx1vpfrlb_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22578%22%20data-orig-height=%22359%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EVespa%20ranking%20is%20unable%20to%20sustain%20the%20same%20amount%20of%20QPS%20as%20just%20transmitting%20the%20data%20(the%20blue%20line),%20which%20is%20a%20hint%20that%20the%20system%20has%20become%20CPU-bound%20on%20the%20evaluation%20of%20the%20model%20on%20Vespa.%20While%20Vespa%20can%20sustain%20around%203500%20QPS,%20the%20TensorFlow%20solution%20maxes%20out%20at%20350%20QPS%20which%20is%20reached%20quite%20early%20as%20we%20increase%20traffic.%20As%20the%20system%20is%20unable%20to%20transmit%20data%20fast%20enough,%20the%20latency%20naturally%20has%20to%20increase%20which%20is%20the%20cause%20for%20the%20linearity%20in%20the%20latency%20graph%20above.%20At%20200%20clients%20the%20average%20latency%20of%20the%20TensorFlow%20solution%20is%20around%20600%20ms,%20while%20Vespa%20is%20around%2060%20ms.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESo,%20the%20obvious%20key%20takeaway%20here%20is%20that%20from%20a%20scalability%20point%20of%20view%20it%20is%20beneficial%20to%20avoid%20sending%20data%20around%20for%20evaluation.%20That%20is%20both%20a%20key%20design%20point%20of%20Vespa,%20but%20also%20for%20why%20we%20implemented%20TensorFlow%20support%20in%20the%20first%20case.%20By%20running%20the%20models%20where%20the%20content%20is%20allows%20for%20better%20utilization%20of%20resources,%20but%20perhaps%20the%20more%20interesting%20aspect%20is%20the%20ability%20to%20run%20more%20complex%20or%20deeper%20models%20while%20still%20being%20able%20to%20scale%20the%20system.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E,http://blog.vespa.ai/post/173669458506

%20article.%20To%20do%20this,%20we%20let%20Vespa%20find%20all%20the%20comments%20for%20the%20article,%20compute%20a%20score%20for%20each,%20and%20pick%20the%20comments%20with%20the%20best%20scores%20to%20show%20to%20the%20user.%20This%20process%20is%20called%20ranking.%20By%20configuring%20the%20function%20to%20compute%20for%20each%20comment%20as%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/reference/ranking-expressions.html%22%3Eranking%20expression%3C/a%3E%20in%20Vespa,%20the%20engine%20will%20compute%20it%20locally%20on%20each%20data%20partition%20in%20parallel%20during%20query%20execution.%20This%20allows%20us%20to%20execute%20these%20queries%20with%20low%20latency%20and%20ensures%20that%20we%20can%20handle%20more%20comments%20by%20adding%20more%20content%20nodes,%20without%20causing%20an%20increase%20in%20latency.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20input%20to%20the%20ranking%20function%20is%20features%20which%20are%20typically%20stored%20in%20the%20comment%20or%20sent%20with%20the%20query.%20Comments%20have%20various%20features%20indicating%20how%20users%20interacted%20with%20the%20comment,%20as%20well%20as%20features%20computed%20from%20the%20comment%20content%20itself.%20In%20addition,%20we%20keep%20track%20of%20the%20reputation%20of%20each%20comment%20author%20as%20a%20feature.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EUser%20actions%20are%20sent%20as%C2%A0%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/document-api.html#put%22%3Eupdate%20operations%3C/a%3E%20to%20Vespa%20as%20they%20are%20performed.%20The%20information%20about%20authors%20is%20also%20continuously%20changing,%20but%20since%20each%20author%20can%20write%20many%20comments%20it%20would%20be%20wasteful%20to%20have%20to%20update%20each%20article%20everytime%20we%20have%20new%20information%20about%20the%20author.%20Instead,%20we%20store%20the%20author%20information%20in%20a%20separate%20document%20type%20-%20one%20document%20per%20author%20and%20use%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/search-definitions. ue%20of%20this%20measure%20of%20interest%20might%20be%20for%20any%20given%20list%20of%20comments.%20Therefore%20it%E2%80%99s%20hard%20to%20create%20a%20training%20set%20of%20interest%20signals%20for%20articles%20(supervised%20learning),%20so%20we%20chose%20to%20use%20reinforcement%20learning%20instead:%20Let%20the%20system%20make%20small%20changes%20to%20the%20live%20machine-learned%20model%20iteratively,%20observe%20the%20effect%20on%20the%20signal%20we%20use%20as%20a%20proxy%20for%20user%20interest,%20and%20use%20this%20to%20converge%20on%20a%20model%20that%20increases%20it.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20model%20chosen%20is%20a%20neural%20net%20with%20multiple%20hidden%20layers,%20roughly%20illustrated%20as%20follows:%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22998%22%20data-orig-height=%22550%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/151063a753002f0caf9a6437c07b824b/tumblr_inline_pm9r40Dpc71wxhpzr_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22998%22%20data-orig-height=%22550%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20advantage%20of%20using%20a%20neural%20net%20compared%20to%20a%20simple%20function%20such%20as%20linear%20regression%20is%20that%20we%20can%20capture%20non-linear%20relationships%20in%20the%20feature%20data%20without%20having%20to%20guess%20which%20relationship%20exists%20and%20hand-write%20functions%20to%20capture%20them%20(feature%20engineering).%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETo%20explore%20the%20space%20of%20possible%20rankings,%20we%20implement%20a%20sampling%20algorithm%20in%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/searcher-development.html%22%3ESearcher%3C/a%3E%20to%20perturb%20the%20ranking%20of%20comments%20returned%20from%20each%20query.%20We%20log%20the%20ranking%20information%20and%20our%20user%20interest%20signals%20such%20as%20dwell%20time%20to%20our%20Hadoop%20grid%20where%20they%20are%20joined.%20This%20generates%20a%20training%20set%20each%20hour%20which%20we%20use%20to%20retrain%20the%20model%20using%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/TensorFlowOnSpark%22%3ETensorFlow-on-Spark%3C/a%3E,%20which%20generates%20a%20new%20model%20for%20the%20next%20iteration%20of%20the%20reinforcement%20learning.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETo%20implement%20this%20on%20Vespa,%20we%20configure%20the%20neural%20net%20as%20the%20ranking%20function%20for%20comments.%20This%20was%20done%20as%20a%20manually%20written%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/tensor-user-guide.html%22%3Eranking%20function%20over%20tensors%3C/a%3E%20in%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/ranking.html%22%3Erank%20profile%3C/a%3E:%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0rank-profile%20neuralNet%20{%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0function%20get_model_weights(field)%20{%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0expression:%20if(query(field)%20==%200,%20constant(field),%20query(field))%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0function%20layer_0()%20{%20%C2%A0#%20returns%20tensor(hidden[9])%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0expression:%20elu(xw_plus_b(nn_input,%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0get_model_weights(W_0),%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0get_model_weights(b_0),%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A %20in%20a%20separate%20document%20type,%20and%20create%20a%20Searcher%20component%20which%20looks%20up%20this%20document%20on%20each%20incoming%20query,%20and%20adds%20the%20parameter%20tensors%20to%20it%20before%20it%E2%80%99s%20passed%20to%20the%20content%20nodes%20for%20evaluation.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EHere%20is%20the%20full%20code%20needed%20to%20accomplish%20this:%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.document.Document;%3Cb%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.document.DocumentId;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.document.Field;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.document.datatypes.FieldValue;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.document.datatypes.TensorFieldValue;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.documentapi.DocumentAccess;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.documentapi.SyncParameters;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.documentapi.SyncSession;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.search.Query;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.search.Result;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.search.Searcher;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.search.searchchain.Execution;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.tensor.Tensor;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Eimport%20java.util.Map;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3Epublic%20class%20LoadRankingmodelSearcher%20extends%20Searcher%20{%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0private%20static%20final%20String%20VESPA_DOCUMENTID_FORMAT%20=%20&ldquo;id:canvass_search:rankingmodel::%s&rdquo;;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0//%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/ranking.html#using-query-variables:%22%3Ehttps://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/ranking.html#using-query-variables:%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0private%20static%20final%20String%20QUERY_FEATURE_FORMAT%20=%20&ldquo;query(%s)&rdquo;;%20%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0/**%20To%20fetch%20model%20documents%20from%20Vespa%20index%20*/%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0private%20final%20SyncSession%20fetchDocumentSession;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0public%20LoadRankingmodelSearcher()%20{%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0this.fetchDocumentSession%20=%20DocumentAccess.createDefault().createSyncSession(new%20SyncParameters.Builder().build());%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0@Override%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0public%20Result%20search(Query%20query,%20Execution%20execution)%20{%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0//%20fetch%20model%20document%20from%20Vespa%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0String%20documentId%20=%20String.format(VESPA_DOCUMENTID_FORMAT,%20query.getRanking().getProfile());%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0Document%20modelDoc%20=%20fetchDocumentSession.get(new%20DocumentId(documentId));%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0//%20Add%20it%20to%20the%20query%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0if%20(modelDoc%20!=%20null)%20{%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0modelDoc.iterator().forEachRemaining((Map.Entry&lt;Field,%20FieldValue&gt;%20e)%20-&gt;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0addTensorFromDocumentToQuery(e.getKey().getName(),%20e.getValue(),%20query)%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0);%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0return%20execution.search(query);%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0private%20static%20void%20addTensorFromDocumentToQuery(String%20field,%20FieldValue%20value,%20Query%20query)%20{%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0if%20(value%20instanceof%20TensorFieldValue)%20{%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0Tensor%20tensor%20=%20((TensorFieldValue)%20value).getTensor().get();%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0query.getRanking().getFeatures().put(String.format(QUERY_FEATURE_FORMAT,%20field),%20tensor);%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20model%20weight%20document%20definition%20is%20added%20to%20the%20same%20content%20cluster%20as%20the%20comment%20documents%20and%20simply%20contains%20attribute%20fields%20for%20each%20weight%20and%20bias%20tensor%20of%20the%20neural%20net:%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0document%20rankingmodel%20{%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0field%20modelTimestamp%20type%20long%20{%20%E2%80%A6%20}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0field%20W_0%20type%20tensor(x[9],hidden[9]){%20%E2%80%A6%20}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0field%20b_0%20type%20tensor(hidden[9]){%20%E2%80%A6%20}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0field%20W_1%20type%20tensor(hidden[9],out[9]){%20%E2%80%A6%20}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0field%20b_1%20type%20tensor(out[9]){%20%E2%80%A6%20}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0field%20W_out%20type%20tensor(out[9]){%20%E2%80%A6%20}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0field%20b_out%20type%20tensor(out[1]){%20%E2%80%A6%20}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%C2%A0%C2%A0%C2%A0}%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESince%20updating%20documents%20is%20a%20lightweight%20operation%20we%20can%20now%20make%20frequent%20changes%20to%20the%20neural%20net%20to%20implement%20the%20reinforcement%20learning.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EResults%3Cbr/%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESwitching%20to%20the%20neural%20net%20model%20with%20reinforcement%20learning%20led%20to%20a%2020%%20increase%20in%20average%20dwell%20time.%20The%20average%20response%20time%20when%20ranking%20with%20the%20neural%20net%20increased%20to%20about%207%20ms%20since%20the%20neural%20net%20model%20is%20more%20expens
