ning%20was%20implemented.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3EReal-time%20comment%20serving%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EAs%20mentioned,%20the%20team%20needed%20a%20system%20that%20can%20add,%20find,%20count,%20and%20serve%20comments%20at%20scale%20in%20real%20time.%20The%20team%20chose%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://vespa.ai/%22%3EVespa%3C/a%3E,%20the%20open%20big%20data%20serving%20engine%20for%20this,%20as%20it%20supports%20both%20such%20basic%20serving%20as%20well%20as%20incorporating%20machine%20learning%20at%20serving%20time%20(which%20we%E2%80%99ll%20get%20to%20below).%20By%20storing%20each%20comment%20as%20a%20separate%20document%20in%20Vespa,%20containing%20the%20ID%20of%20the%20article%20commented%20upon,%20the%20ID%20of%20the%20user%20commenting,%20various%20comment%20metadata,%20and%20the%20comment%20text%20itself,%20the%20team%20could%20issue%20queries%20to%20quickly%20retrieve%20the%20comments%20on%20a%20given%20article%20for%20display,%20or%20to%20show%20a%20comment%20count%20next%20to%20the%20article:%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22599%22%20data-orig-height=%2297%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/add771190235c0e2a7662c61cad68f45/tumblr_inline_pmtjg3h2BD1qzr4dq_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22599%22%20data-orig-height=%2297%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20addition,%20this%20document%20structure%20allowed%20less-used%20operations%20such%20as%20showing%20all%20the%20articles%20of%20a%20given%20user%20and%20similar.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20Vespa%20instance%20used%20at%20Yahoo%20for%20this%20store%20about%20a%20billion%20comments%20at%20any%20time,%20serve%20about%2012.000%20queries%20per%20second,%20and%20about%20twice%20as%20many%20writes%20(new%20comments%20+%20comment%20metadata%20updates).%20Average%20latency%20for%20queries%20is%20about%204%20ms,%20and%20write%20latency%20roughly%201%20ms.%20Nodes%20are%20organized%20in%20two%20tiers%20as%20a%20single%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/cloudconfig/application-packages.html%22%3EVespa%20application%3C/a%3E:%20A%20single%20stateless%20cluster%20handling%20incoming%20queries%20and%20writes,%20and%20a%20content%20cluster%20storing%20the%20comments,%20maintaining%20indexes%20and%20executing%20the%20distributed%20part%20of%20queries%20in%20parallel.%20In%20total,%2032%20stateless%20and%2096%20stateful%20nodes%20are%20spread%20over%205%20regional%20data%20centers.%20Data%20is%20automatically%20sharded%20by%20Vespa%20in%20each%20datacenter,%20in%206%E2%80%9312%20shards%20depending%20on%20the%20traffic%20patterns%20of%20that%20region.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3ERanking%20comments%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3ESome%20articles%20on%20Yahoo%20pages%20have%20a%20very%20large%20number%20of%20comments%E2%80%8A%E2%80%94%E2%80%8Aup%20to%20hundreds%20of%20thousands%20are%20not%20uncommon,%20and%20no%20user%20is%20going%20to%20read%20all%20of%20them.%20Therefore%20it%20is%20necessary%20to%20pick%20the%20best%20comments%20to%20show%20each%20time%20someone%20views%20an%20article.%20Vespa%20does%20this%20by%20finding%20all%20the%20comments%20for%20the%20article,%20computing%20a%20score%20for%20each,%20and%20picking%20the%20comments%20with%20the%20best%20scores%20to%20show%20to%20the%20user.%20This%20process%20is%20called%20ranking.%20By%20configuring%20the%20function%20to%20compute%20for%20each%20comment%20as%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/reference/ranking-expressions.html%22%3Eranking%20expression%3C/a%3E%20in%20Vespa,%20the%20engine%20will%20compute%20it%20locally%20on%20each%20data%20partition%20in%20parallel%20during%20query%20execution.%20This%20allows%20executing%20these%20queries%20with%20low%20latency%20and%20ensures%20that%20more%20comments%20can%20be%20handled%20by%20adding%20more%20content%20nodes,%20without%20causing%20an%20increase%20in%20latency.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20input%20to%20the%20ranking%20function%20is%20features%20which%20are%20typically%20stored%20in%20the%20document%20(here:%20a%20comment)%20or%20sent%20with%20the%20query.%20Comments%20have%20various%20features%20indicating%20how%20users%20interacted%20with%20the%20comment,%20as%20well%20as%20features%20computed%20from%20the%20comment%20content%20itself.%20In%20addition,%20the%20system%20keeps%20track%20of%20the%20reputation%20of%20each%20comment%20author%20as%20a%20feature.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EUser%20actions%20are%20sent%20as%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/document-api.html#put%22%3Eupdate%20operations%3C/a%3E%20to%20Vespa%20as%20they%20are%20performed.%20The%20information%20about%20authors%20is%20also%20continuously%20changing,%20but%20since%20each%20author%20can%20write%20many%20comments%20it%20would%20be%20wasteful%20to%20have%20to%20update%20each%20comment%20every%20time%20there%20is%20new%20information%20about%20the%20author.%20Instead,%20the%20author%20information%20is%20stored%20in%20a%20separate%20document%20type%E2%80%8A%E2%80%94%E2%80%8Aone%20document%20per%20author,%20and%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/search-definitions.html#document-references%22%3Edocument%20reference%3C/a%3E%20in%20Vespa%20is%20used%20to%20import%20that%20author%20feature%20into%20each%20comment.%20This%20allows%20updating%20the%20author%20information%20once%20and%20have%20it%20automatically%20take%20effect%20for%20all%20comments%20by%20that%20author.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWith%20these%20features,%20it%E2%80%99s%20possible%20in%20Vespa%20to%20configure%20a%20mathematical%20function%20as%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/reference/ranking-expressions.html%22%3Eranking%20expression%3C/a%3E%20which%20computes%20the%20rank%20score%20or%20each%20comment%20to%20produce%20a%20ranked%20list%20of%20the%20top%20comments,%20like%20the%20following:%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22646%22%20data-orig-height=%22392%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/1ba52b8dc7064299f19a0bef04766b56/tumblr_inline_pmtjhsSQ9e1qzr4dq_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22646%22%20data-orig-height=%22392%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Ch2%3EUsing%20a%20neural%20net%20and%20reinforcement%20learning%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20team%20used%20to%20rank%20comments%20with%20a%20handwritten%20ranking%20expression%20having%20hardcoded%20weighting%20of%20the%20features.%20This%20is%20a%20good%20way%20to%20get%20started%20but%20obviously%20not%20optimal.%20To%20improve%20it%20they%20needed%20to%20decide%20on%20a%20measurable%20target%20and%20use%20machine%20learning%20to%20optimize%20towards%20it.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20ultimate%20goal%20is%20for%20users%20to%20find%20the%20comments%20interesting.%20This%20can%20not%20be%20measured%20directly,%20but%20luckily%20we%20can%20define%20a%20good%20proxy%20for%20interest%20based%20on%20signals%20such%20as%20dwell%20time%20(the%20amount%20of%20time%20the%20users%20spend%20on%20the%20comments%20of%20an%20article)%20and%20user%20actions%20(whether%20users%20reply%20to%20comments,%20provide%20upvotes%20and%20downvotes,%20etc).%20The%20team%20knew%20they%20wanted%20user%20interest%20to%20go%20up%20on%20average,%20but%20there%20is%20no%20way%20to%20know%20what%20the%20correct%20value%20of%20the%20measure%20of%20interest%20might%20be%20for%20any%20single%20given%20list%20of%20comments.%20Therefore%20it%E2%80%99s%20hard%20to%20create%20a%20training%20set%20of%20interest%20signals%20for%20articles%20(supervised%20learning),%20so%20reinforcement%20learning%20was%20chosen%20instead:%20Let%20the%20system%20make%20small%20changes%20to%20the%20live%20machine-learned%20model%20iteratively,%20observe%20the%20effect%20on%20the%20signal%20used%20as%20a%20proxy%20for%20user%20interest,%20and%20use%20this%20to%20converge%20on%20a%20model%20that%20increases%20it.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20model%20chosen%20here%20was%20a%20neural%20net%20with%20multiple%20hidden%20layers,%20roughly%20illustrated%20as%20follows:%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22645%22%20data-orig-height=%22383%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/3dc0238d106cff121c0cd0ee22b0f53a/tumblr_inline_pmtji8pgZX1qzr4dq_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22645%22%20data-orig-height=%22383%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20advantage%20of%20using%20a%20neural%20net%20compared%20to%20a%20simple%20function%20such%20as%20linear%20regression%20is%20that%20it%20can%20capture%20non-linear%20relationships%20in%20the%20feature%20data%20without%20anyone%20having%20to%20guess%20which%20relationship%20exists%20and%20hand-write%20functions%20to%20capture%20them%20(feature%20engineering).%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETo%20explore%20the%20space%20of%20possible%20rankings,%20the%20team%20implemented%20a%20sampling%20algorithm%20in%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/searcher-development.html%22%3ESearcher%3C/a%3E%20to%20perturb%20the%20ranking%20of%20comments%20returned%20from%20each%20query.%20They%20logged%20the%20ranking%20information%20and%20user%20interest%20signals%20such%20as%20dwell%20time%20to%20their%20Hadoop%20grid%20where%20they%20are%20joined.%20This%20generates%20a%20training%20set%20each%20hour%20which%20is%20used%20to%20retrain%20the%20model%20using%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/TensorFlowOnSpark%22%3ETensorFlow-on-Spark%3C/a%3E,%20which%20produces%20a%20new%20model%20for%20the%20next%20iteration%20of%20the%20reinforcement%20learning%20cycle.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETo%20implement%20this%20on%20Vespa,%20the%20team%20configured%20the%20neural%20net%20as%20the%20ranking%20function%20for%20comments.%20This%20was%20done%20as%20a%20manually%20written%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/tensor-user-guide.html%22%3Eranking%20function%20over%20tensors%3C/a%3E%20in%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/ranking.html%22%3Erank%20profile%3C/a%3E.%20Here%20is%20the%20production%20configuration%20used:%3C/p%3E%3Cpre%3Erank-profile%20neuralNet%20{%20%C2%A0function%20get_model_weights(field)%20{%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0expression:%20if(query(field)%20==%200,%20constant(field),%20query(field))%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0}%20%C2%A0function%20layer_0()%20{%20#%20returns%20tensor(hidden[9])%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0expression:%20elu(xw_plus_b(nn_input,%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0get_model_weights(W_0),%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0get_model_weights(b_0),%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0x))%20%C2%A0}%20%C2%A0function%20layer_1()%20{%20#%20returns%20tensor(out[9])%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0expression:%20elu(xw_plus_b(layer_0,%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0get_model_weights(W_1),%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0get_model_weights(b_1),%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0hidden))%20%C2%A0}%20%C2%A0#%20xw_plus_b%20returns%20tensor(out[1]),%20so%20sum%20converts%20to%20double%20%C2%A0function%20layer_out()%20{%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0expression:%20sum(xw_plus_b(layer_1,%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0get_model_weights(W_out),%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0get_model_weights(b_out),%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0out))%20%C2%A0}%20%C2%A0first-phase%20{%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0expression:%20freshnessRank%20%C2%A0}%20%C2%A0second-phase%20{%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0expression:%20layer_out%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0rerank-count:%202000%20%C2%A0}}%3C/pre%3E%3Cp%3EMore%20recently%20Vespa%20added%20support%20for%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/tensorflow.html%22%3Edeploying%20TensorFlow%20SavedModels%20directly%3C/a%3E%20(as%20well%20as%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/onnx.html%22%3Esimilar%20support%20for%20tools%20saving%20in%20the%20ONNX%20format%3C/a%3E),%20which%20would%20also%20be%20a%20good%20option%20here%20since%20the%20training%20happens%20in%20TensorFlow.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ENeural%20nets%20have%20a%20pair%20of%20weight%20and%20bias%20tensors%20for%20each%20layer,%20which%20is%20what%20the%20team%20wanted%20the%20training%20process%20to%20optimize.%20The%20simplest%20way%20to%20include%20the%20weights%20and%20biases%20in%20the%20model%20is%20to%20add%20them%20as%20constant%20tensorsto%20the%20application%20package.%20However,%20with%20reinforcement%20learning%20it%20is%20necessary%20to%20be%20able%20update%20these%20tensor%20parameters%20frequently.%20This%20could%20be%20achieved%20by%20redeploying%20the%20application%20package%20frequently,%20as%20Vespa%20allows%20that%20to%20be%20done%20without%20restarts%20or%20disruption%20to%20ongoing%20queries.%20However,%20it%20is%20still%20a%20somewhat%20heavy-weight%20process,%20so%20another%20approach%20was%20chosen:%20Store%20the%20neural%20net%20parameters%20as%20tensors%20in%20a%20separate%20document%20type%20in%20Vespa,%20and%20create%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/searcher-development.html%22%3ESearcher%3C/a%3E%20component%20which%20looks%20up%20this%20document%20on%20each%20incoming%20query,%20and%20adds%20the%20parameter%20tensors%20to%20it%20before%20it%E2%80%99s%20passed%20to%20the%20content%20nodes%20for%20evaluation.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EHere%20is%20the%20full%20production%20code%20needed%20to%20accomplish%20this%20serving-time%20operation:%3C/p%3E%3Cpre%3Eimport%20com.yahoo.document.Document;import%20com.yahoo.document.DocumentId;import%20com.yahoo.document.Field;import%20com.yahoo.document.datatypes.FieldValue;import%20com.yahoo.document.datatypes.TensorFieldValue;import%20com.yahoo.documentapi.DocumentAccess;import%20com.yahoo.documentapi.SyncParameters;import%20com.yahoo.documentapi.SyncSession;import%20com.yahoo.search.Query;import%20com.yahoo.search.Result;import%20com.yahoo.search.Searcher;import%20com.yahoo.search.searchchain.Execution;import%20com.yahoo.tensor.Tensor;import%20java.util.Map;public%20class%20LoadRankingmodelSearcher%20extends%20Searcher%20{%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0private%20static%20final%20String%20VESPA_ID_FORMAT%20=%20%22id:canvass_search:rankingmodel::%s%22;%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0//%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/ranking.html#using-query-variables:%22%3Ehttps://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/ranking.html#using-query-variables:%3C/a%3E%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0private%20static%20final%20String%20FEATURE_FORMAT%20=%20%22query(%s)%22;%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0/**%20To%20fetch%20model%20documents%20from%20Vespa%20index%20*/%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0private%20final%20SyncSession%20fetchDocumentSession;%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0public%20LoadRankingmodelSearcher()%20{%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0this.fetchDocumentSession%20=%20%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20DocumentAccess.createDefault()%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20.createSyncSession(new%20SyncParameters.Builder().build());%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0}%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0@Override%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0public%20Result%20search(Query%20query,%20Execution%20execution)%20{%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0//%20Fetch%20model%20document%20from%20Vespa%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0String%20id%20=%20String.format(VESPA_ID_FORMAT,%20query.getRanking().getProfile());%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0Document%20modelDoc%20=%20fetchDocumentSession.get(new%20DocumentId(id));%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0//%20Add%20it%20to%20the%20query%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0if%20(modelDoc%20!=%20null)%20{%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0modelDoc.iterator().forEachRemaining((Map.Entry&lt;Field,%20FieldValue&gt;%20e)%20-&gt;%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0addTensorFromDocumentToQuery(e.getKey().getName(),%20e.getValue(),%20query)%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20);%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0}%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0return%20execution.search(query);%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0}%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0private%20static%20void%20addTensorFromDocumentToQuery(String%20field,%20%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20FieldValue%20value,%20%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20Query%20query)%20{%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0if%20(value%20instanceof%20TensorFieldValue)%20{%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0Tensor%20tensor%20=%20((TensorFieldValue)%20value).getTensor().get();%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0query.getRanking().getFeatures().put(String.format(FEATURE_FORMAT,%20field),%20%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20tensor);%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0}%20%C2%A0%20%C2%A0}}%3C/pre%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20model%20weight%20document%20definition%20is%20added%20to%20the%20same%20content%20cluster%20as%20the%20comment%20documents%20and%20simply%20contains%20attribute%20fields%20for%20each%20weight%20and%20bias%20tensor%20of%20the%20neural%20net%20(where%20each%20field%20below%20is%20configured%20with%20%E2%80%9Cindexing:%20attribute%20|%20summary%E2%80%9D):%3C/p%3E%3Cpre%3Edocument%20rankingmodel%20{%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0%3Cbr/%3E%20%C2%A0field%20modelTimestamp%20type%20long%20{%20%E2%80%A6%20}%20%C2%A0field%20W_0%20type%20tensor(x[9],hidden[9])%20{%20%E2%80%A6%20}%20%C2%A0field%20b_0%20type%20tensor(hidden[9])%20{%20%E2%80%A6%20}%20%C2%A0field%20W_1%20type%20tensor(hidden[9],out[9])%20{%20%E2%80%A6%20}%20%C2%A0field%20b_1%20type%20tensor(out[9])%20{%20%E2%80%A6%20}%20%C2%A0field%20W_out%20type%20tensor(out[9])%20{%20%E2%80%A6%20}%20%C2%A0field%20b_out%20type%20tensor(out[1])%20{%20%E2%80%A6%20}}%3C/pre%3E%3Cp%3ESince%20updating%20documents%20is%20a%20lightweight%20operation%20it%20is%20now%20possible%20to%20make%20frequent%20changes%20to%20the%20neural%20net%20to%20implement%20the%20reinforcement%20learning%20process.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3EResults%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3ESwitching%20to%20the%20neural%20net%20model%20with%20reinforcement%20learning%20has%20already%20led%20to%20a%2020%%20increase%20in%20average%20dwell%20time.%20The%20average%20response%20time%20when%20ranking%20with%20the%20neural%20net%20increased%20to%20about%207%20ms%20since%20the%20neural%20net%20model%20is%20more%20expensive.%20The%20response%20time%20stays%20low%20because%20in%20Vespa%20the%20neural%20net%20is%20evaluated%20on%20all%20the%20content%20nodes%20(partitions)%20in%20parallel.%20This%20avoids%20the%20bottleneck%20of%20sending%20the%20data%20for%20each%20comment%20to%20be%20evaluated%20over%20the%20network%20and%20allows%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://medium.com/vespa/scaling-serving-time-tensorflow-model-evaluation-with-vespa-853f76ae5efd%22%3Eincreasing%20parallelization%20indefinitely%3C/a%3E%20by%20adding%20more%20content%20nodes.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EHowever,%20evaluating%20the%20neural%20net%20for%20all%20comments%20for%20outlier%20articles%20which%20have%20hundreds%20of%20thousands%20of%20comments%20would%20still%20be%20very%20costly.%20If%20you%20read%20the%20rank%20profile%20configuration%20shown%20above,%20you%E2%80%99ll%20have%20noticed%20the%20solution%20to%20this:%20Two-phase%20ranking%20was%20used%20where%20the%20comments%20are%20first%20selected%20by%20a%20cheap%20rank%20function%20(termed%20freshnessRank)%20and%20the%20highest%20scoring%202000%20documents%20(per%20content%20node)%20are%20re-ranked%20using%20the%20neural%20net.%20This%20caps%20the%20max%20CPU%20spent%20on%20evaluating%20the%20neural%20net%20per%20query.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3EConclusion%20and%20future%20work%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20this%20article%20I%20have%20shown%20how%20to%20implement%20a%20real%20comment%20serving%20and%20ranking%20system%20on%20Vespa.%20With%20reinforcement%20learning%20gaining%20popularity,%20the%20serving%20system%20needs%20to%20become%20a%20more%20integrated%20part%20of%20the%20machine%20learning%20stack,%20and%20by%20using%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://vespa.ai/%22%3EVespa%3C/a%3E%20this%20can%20be%20accomplished%20relatively%20easily%20with%20a%20standard%20open%20source%20technology.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20team%20working%20on%20this%20plan%20to%20expand%20on%20this%20work%20by%20applying%20it%20to%20other%20domains%20such%20as%20content%20recommendation,%20incorporating%20more%20features%20in%20a%20larger%20network,%20and%20exploring%20personalized%20comment%20ranking.%3C/p%3E,http://blog.vespa.ai/post/182759620076

egarding%20external%20API%20for%20autosuggest%20we%20use%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://blog.cloudflare.com/introducing-cloudflare-workers/%22%3ECloudflare%20Workers%3C/a%3E%20(supporting%20Javascript%20on%20V8%20and%20later%20perhaps%20multiple%20languages%20with%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://webassembly.org%22%3EWebassembly%3C/a%3E)%20to%20handle%20API%20queries%20from%20Zedge%20apps%20in%20front%20of%20Vespa%20running%20in%20Google%20Cloud.%20This%20setup%20allow%20for%20simple%20close-to-user%20caching%20of%20autosuggest%20results.%20%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3ESearch,%20Recommenders%20and%20Related%20Content%20with%20Vespa%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EWithout%20going%20into%20details%20we%20had%20several%20recommender%20and%20search%20services%20to%20adapt%20to%20Vespa.%20These%20services%20were%20adapted%20by%20writing%20custom%20Vespa%20searchers%20and%20in%20some%20cases%20search%20chains:%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/searcher-development.html%22%3Ehttps://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/searcher-development.html%3C/a%3E%C2%A0%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/chained-components.html%22%3Ehttps://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/chained-components.html%3C/a%3E%C2%A0%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20main%20change%20compared%20to%20our%20old%20recommender%20and%20related%20content%20services%20was%20the%20degree%20of%20dynamicity%20and%20freshness%20of%20serving,%20i.e.%20with%20Vespa%20more%20ranking%20signals%20are%20calculated%20on%20the%20fly%20using%20Vespa%E2%80%99s%20tensor%20support%20instead%20of%20being%20precalculated%20and%20fed%20into%20services%20periodically.%20Another%20benefit%20of%20this%20was%20that%20the%20amount%20of%20computational%20(big%20data)%20resources%20and%20code%20for%20recommender%20&amp;%20related%20content%20processing%20was%20heavily%20reduced.%3C/p%3E%3Ch4%3EContinuous%20Integration%20and%20Testing%20with%20Vespa%3C/h4%3E%3Cp%3EA%20main%20focus%20was%20to%20make%20testing%20and%
